title: anton_chigurh
body: A character in [[No Country for Old Men]]. A psychopathic hitman who is devoid of compassion and empathy, willing to kill absolutely anyone for even just slightly inconveniencing him. Perhaps the most noteworthy character in the story. His weapons of choice are a captive bolt stunner and a [[suppressor|suppressed]] [[Remington arms|Remington 11-87]].

title: takada_akemi
body:
高田 明美 (たかだ あけみ)

A female manga artist born on March 31, 1955 (ANN states 1952) in Tokyo, [[Japan]]. She is a popular anime character designer, noted for her long collaboration with director [[Mamoru Oshii]]. She graduated from Tama Art University, after which she worked for [[Tatsunoko Pro]]. Her anime character design work includes [i][[Kimagure Orange Road]][/i] and [i][[Patlabor]][/i].

She is currently a freelance manga artist with her own studio, though she is also a member of the creative group [[Headgear]]. She also has her own designer jewelry store called Diakosmos. [i](source: Wikipedia)[/i]

title: black_cat_(marvel)
body: Black Cat (Felicia Hardy) is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Marv Wolfman, Keith Pollard, and Dave Cockrum, the character first appeared in The Amazing Spider-Man #194 (July 1979). Felicia Hardy is the daughter of Walter Hardy, a world-renowned cat burglar. She trained herself in various fighting styles and acrobatics and, after deciding to follow in her father's footsteps, adopted the costumed identity of Black Cat. She has the subconscious ability to affect probability fields, producing "bad luck" for her enemies. Throughout her history, Black Cat has sometimes been an enemy, love interest, and an ally of the superhero [[Spider-Man]].

title: tigra
body: Tigra (Greer Grant Nelson) is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer-editor Roy Thomas and artist Wally Wood (Marie Severin was then brought in to help layout the art), with her early adventures written by Linda Fite, the character first appeared as the superpowered and gadget-wielding crime fighter the Cat in The Claws of the Cat #1 (November 1972). She first appeared as Tigra in Giant-Size Creatures #1 (July 1974), by writer Tony Isabella and artist Don Perlin.

title: watermelon
body:
A large, roundish melon with a hard, green-striped rind and sweet, watery and red (occasionally yellowish) pulp. A tasty [[summer]] treat.

Whereas most varieties are oblong, Japanese-grown watermelons are nearly perfect spheres.

title: ultra_galaxy_(series)
body:
A sub-series in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], which began in 2007. Has an eye towards fan service of some capacity, and elements from it often cross over into and linking together main installments in the franchise. The main domain of [[Ultraman Zero]], who serves as the sub-series' perennial protagonist, who would also host [i]Ultraman Retsuden[/i] and [i]Shin Ultraman Retsuden[/i] from 2011 to 2016 (and these would be followed up by [i]Ultraman Zero: The Chronicle[/i] from 2017, which recounts the main entries he had appeared in, all while still hosting, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Zero & Geed[/i] from 2020, which follows it up while being hosted by Asakura Riku, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Z: Heroes' Odyssey[/i] from 2021, and [i]Ultraman New Generation Stars[/i] from 2023 onward).

The sub-series can be subdivided into two main eras; the first era which sees the rise of the Reionics, with [[Reiblood Seijin]] and [[Ultraman Belial]] acting as its main antagonists, and the second era which sees a greater focus on multiversal stories, culminating in the emergence of the Absolutians as its main antagonists.

h4. Titles

h5. Reiblood Era

* [[Ultra Galaxy Mega Dai-Kaijuu Battle]] (2007-2009)
** [i]Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Adventure[/i] (2008-2010)
* [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]] (2009)
* [[Ultraman Zero vs. Darklops Zero]] (2010)
* [[Ultraman Zero The Movie Choukessen! Belial Ginga Teikoku]] (2010)

h5. Multiversal Era

* [i]Killer the Beatstar[/i] (2011)
* [[Ultraman Saga (movie)|]] (2012)
* [i]Ultra Zero Fight[/i] (2012-2013)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: New Generation Heroes]] (2019)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]] (2020-2021)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]] (2021-2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos: First Mission[/i] (2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos[/i] (2023)

h4. See also

* [[Ultraman Geed (series)|]] - first installment spinning off from Ultra Galaxy, with the protagonist being the son of Belial
* [[Ultraman Z (series)|]] - second installment spinning off, with the protagonist being trained by Zero

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Galaxy_Fight

title: eternity_larva
body:
[b]The Butterfly Fairy who Approaches God[/b]

Stage 1 boss of the [i][[Touhou]][/i] game [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i]. In the demo, her name was misspelled as [b]Etarnity Larva[/b].

She has [[aqua_hair|aqua hair]] with [[brown_eyes|brown eyes]]. She has a forked [[antennae|antenna]] (actually an "osmeterium":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osmeterium) atop her head accompanied with some [[leaf_on_head|leaves around her head]]. She wears a [[green_dress|green]], larva-shaped dress and is [[barefoot|barefooted]]. She has a pair of [[butterfly_wings|butterfly wings]] on her back. She is depicted with her [[outstretched_arms|arms stretched out]] in her character portrait. Her dress has [[short_sleeves|short sleeves]].

She is a butterfly fairy embodying the life cycle of a butterfly. Her abilities let her scatter scales. She is normally very gentle, but the incident has empowered her to be a bit more aggressive than usual.

[spoiler] In [[Cirno|Cirno's]] Extra route, [[Matara_Okina|Okina]] speculates that Eternity may not be a mere fairy, but is in fact a Tokoyo Kami (or God of the Everlasting World) and one of her enemies. [/spoiler]

h4. External links

* Touhou Wiki: https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Eternity_Larva

title: magolor
body:
A character in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i]. Known as [b]Mahoroa[/b] in the Japanese release. He enlists the help of [[Kirby]] [[king_dedede|and]] [[meta_knight|his]] [[bandana_waddle_dee|friends]] to repair his spaceship, the [[Lor Starcutter]].

[spoiler]His true motives are hardly mentioned until the very end of the main story, where it is revealed that he really wanted to steal the [[Master Crown]] from its guardian, [[Landia]]. After he succeeds, he tries to conquer the universe, starting with [[Pop Star]]. Fortunately, Kirby and company are able to stop him.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After his defeat, he surprisingly tries to make amends with Kirby, and reveals he may have been used as a puppet by the Master Crown itself.[/spoiler] He starts by building an amusement park for the puffball's 20th anniversary, and he continues to provide support for future adventures, including running a shop in [i][[Team Kirby Clash Deluxe]][/i] and being a Dream Friend in [i][[kirby:_star_allies|Kirby Star Allies]][/i].

h4. See Also

title: crayon_shin-chan
body:
A manga series drawn by [[Usui Yoshito]] serialized in [i]Manga Action[/i] from August 1990 to March 2010. With an anime adaptation by [i]Shin-Ei Animation[/i] that began Spring 1992. Rather (in)famous for its plethora of toilet humor.

The series follows the adventures of 5 year old, Shinnosuke with his family and friends. They live in Kasukabe, Saitama Prefecture, Japan.

title: subterranean_animism
body:
東方地霊殿 ("Touhou [[Chireiden]]") ~ Subterranean Animism
("Eastern Palace of Earth Spirits")

Fourteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, eleventh of the mainstream lineup and ninth of the Windows generation, as well as the sixth of the same generation's mainstream games.

One wintry day, a geyser laden with evil spirits erupted near the Hakurei Shrine. Due to a noninterference agreement between overground and underground youkai, two humans - [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]], each with an overground youkai to their aid via a magic artifact - were sent underground to investigate, finding the geyser to be a cry for help by a [[kaenbyou_rin|feline creature]] concerned about her [[reiuji_utsuho|avian friend]]'s sudden change in character and her naive plot to turn [[Gensokyo]] into a part of Hell.

h4. Characters

h5. Heroines (with selectable partners)

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]

title: uno_(game)
body:
Commercial card game developed in 1971 by Merle Robbins from the [[playing card]] game Crazy Eights. It is currently marketed by Mattel.

In the game, players discard cards matching the color or number/symbol of the card on a discard pile. Certain action cards call the next color to play, reverse the direction of play, force the next player to draw a certain number of cards, or forfeit the next player's turn altogether. A player has to shout "Uno" (Spanish/Italian for "one") to warn other players they are down to their last card; a round ends when a player runs out of cards. Points are scored by adding values of the other players' cards and awarded to the player that ran out.

One popular house rule (not an official rule) is to counter a "Draw 2/4" card by playing a similar "Draw 2/4" card, thus "stacking" the number of cards the following player has to draw.

h4. See also:

* [[uno reverse card]]
* [[Draw 25 (meme)]]
* [[Imminent Uno loss (meme)]]
* [[Moero! Card Match UNO]]
* [[Mimukauwa Nice Try (Vocaloid)]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":[http://mattelgames.com/en-us/cards/uno]
* "Official Japanese website":[https://mattel.co.jp/toys/uno/]
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uno_(card_game)]

title: bandages
body:
A woven strip of material typically used medically in order to support a dressing or splint, or to provide support to the body.

Sometimes bandages can be used/worn as an accessory or even as a form of clothing (protective or otherwise) as opposed to being used exclusively for medical purposes. One of the best and most prominent examples of this is when a character wears bandages binding their breasts/chest or torso, in which case it would be known as a [[sarashi]].

title: takashi_shirogane
body:
[i][[Voltron: Legendary Defender]][/i] character. Mainly known by his nickname "Shiro".

A young man that suddenly returns to Earth after being captured by the Galra on an expedition a year prior to the main story. Takes the name and physical appearance of the [i]Golion[/i] former [[Ao-jishi]] pilot [[Shirogane Takashi]], but takes the place of [[Kogane Akira]] as the [[kuro-jishi (golion)|Kuro-jishi]] pilot and [spoiler]initial[/spoiler] leader of Voltron/Golion. Has Galra tech as a [[amputee|replacement arm]].

title: sleepy
body:
Feeling the need to [[sleeping|sleep]], either at the end of the [[day]] or when [[waking up]] in the [[morning]].

Common signs of sleepiness include [[one eye closed]] or [[half-closed eyes]], [[yawning]], [[stretching|stretching]], [[rubbing eyes]], [[bags under eyes]], and [[squeans|sleep bubbles]] around the head.

See [[exhausted]] for when someone is tired due to [[exercising]] or strenuous physical activity.

title: cancer_(disease)
body:
A malignant growth or tumor resulting from the division of abnormal cells. Often this refers to images of people suffering from cancer and undergoing chemotherapy treatment to either eliminate or control the disease. Common ways to depict cancer include [[bald]]ing and [[emaciated|emaciation]] in those affected, if tumorous bulging or growths are not outright visible in the image.

For the [[Zodiac]] constellation, see [[Cancer (zodiac)|]].

body:

Spreading buttocks, laid out across a surface (desk, table etc.) or in [[top-down bottom-up]] sexual situations.

title: cum_inflation
body:
When [[cum]] causes [[inflation]] of a character's stomach.

This tag should not be used unless cum is causing the stomach to inflate. Even if the stomach is inflated or bulging and there is cum, it must be apparent that the cum is itself causing the inflation, for example, through an [[x-ray]] view.

title: recursion
body:
When a concept depends on itself.

In artwork, this often takes the form of the [b]Droste effect[/b], in which the image contains a smaller version of itself within it, and that smaller version contains an even smaller version, and so on.

Can also refer to other forms of self-reference.

h4. See also

* [[clone]]
* [[fractal]]
* [[mirror]]
* [[recurring image]]
* [[recursion]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: kizuna_akari
body:
Kizuna Akari is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] (and [[VOICEROID]]) developed by Vocalomakets and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID4 engine. In 2021, she received updated voicebanks on the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine.

Her appearance was illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]]. She has [[white hair|white]] [[twin braids]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[black jacket]], a [[black dress|black]] [[pinafore dress]], and a [[vertical-striped pantyhose]]. She has [[hair ornament]]s, a single [[bracelet]], and black boots.

title: help:home
body:
h4. Welcome to the Danbooru Wiki Help!

[quote]
Danbooru [dahn-boh-ruh] ([i]noun[/i]):
1. ([i]on donmai.us[/i]) A repository of high-quality anime-style art and doujinshi.
2. A taggable imageboard, with sophisticated features for keeping, organizing and finding pictures.
3. ([i]Japanese[/i]) Corrugated cardboard box.
[/quote]


h5. Rules

Please familiarize yourself with the [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]], [[help:community rules|Community Rules]] and the "Terms of Service":[/terms_of_service]. All users are obliged to follow these rules for everyone's benefit. 

h5. Guide

Searching [b]([[help:cheatsheet|Search Cheat Sheet]])[/b]
Posts [b]([[help:upload|Uploading Guidelines]] | [[howto:rate|Rating Guidelines]] | [[help:post_relationships|Parent and Child Posts]])[/b]
Tags [b]([[howto:tag|Tagging Guidelines]] | [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]] | [[Tag Groups]])[/b]
Users [b]([[help:users|User Levels]])[/b]
Pools [b]([[help:pools|Pool Guidelines]] | [[Pool Groups]])[/b]
Moderation [b]([[about:mod_queue|Moderation Queue]] | [[howto:flag|Flagging Posts]] | [[howto:appeal|Appealing Posts]] | [[about:upload_limits|Upload Limits]] | [[help:user_records|Issuing User Records]]) [/b]
Notes [b]([[howto:Translate|Translations]] | [[about:note_formatting|Note Formatting]])[/b]
Artists [b]([[howto:Artist|Artists]] | [[howto:pixiv|Pixiv Artists]]) ("Banned Artists":[/artists/banned])[/b]
Wiki [b]([[howto:wiki|Writing Wiki Entries]] | [[List of Meta-Wikis]]) [/b]
Userscripts [b]([[about:userscripts]])[/b]
Custom CSS [b]([[about:custom css style]])[/b]
DText [b]([[help:dtext|DText Cheat Sheet]])[/b]

h5. Contributors: HELP WANTED

Posts [b]({{image_sample}} | {{md5_mismatch}} | {{source_request}} | {{bad_source}} | {{source:none}})[/b]
Tags [b]("list of deprecated tags":/tags?commit=Search&search%5Bhide_empty%5D=yes&search%5Bis_deprecated%5D=yes&search%5Border%5D=date | {{tagme}} | {{character_request}} | {{copyright_request}} | {{artist_request}})[/b]
Translations [b]({{translation_request}} | {{partially_translated}} | {{check_translation}})[/b]
Commentary Translations [b]({{commentary_request}} | {{partial_commentary}} | {{check_commentary}})[/b]
Other Information [b]({{source_request}} | {{annotation_request}} | {{clothing_request}} | {{flower_request}} | {{weapon_request}} | {{food_request}})[/b]
Upload Bounty Thread: topic #24186
Shinjidude's Tasks to Do: topic #5076

h4. Information for Lurkers and New Users

h5. [[howto:get_started|Getting Started: Danbooru New Lurkers Guide!]]

New to Danbooru and the concept of our site? This primer is for you. It contains an introduction to browsing and searching, and some of the features of a basic account. It will take about an hour to finish.

h5. [[help:glossary|Glossary of Terms]]

Familiarize yourself with some of the lingo used by members. Also great as a recap for long-time users.

h5. [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide (Becoming a Contributor)]]

Lurked long enough? Want to help out? This guide introduces you to the things you need to know to become a contributor!


h4. More Help?

h5. [[help:toc|Danbooru Help Table of Contents]]
The Table of Contents is the ultimate list of Help pages and Tutorials.

h5. [[help:frequently_asked_questions|Frequently Asked Questions]]
A page that strives to answer your frequent questions about uploading posts, the tagging system, and user levels.

h5. [[List of Meta-Wikis]]
See the list of meta-wikis for the full list of tag groups, character lists, and help and howto pages.

title: type-moon_heroines
body:
Images featuring [b]at least three[/b] of the four [[TYPE-MOON]] heroines grouped together:
* [[Aozaki Aoko]] from [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]]
* [[Arcueid Brunestud]] from [[Tsukihime]]
* [[Ryougi Shiki]] from [[Kara no Kyoukai]]
* [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] from [[Fate (series)|]] (usually [[Saber (fate)|]] from [[Fate/stay night]])

They may or may not also be accompanied by their male companions [[Shizuki Soujuurou]], [[Tohno Shiki]], [[Kokutou Mikiya]], and [[Emiya Shirou]]. Other heroines from TYPE-MOON projects may be included alongside them, like [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]] or [[Katsuragi Chikagi]] and [[Hibino Hibiki]] from [[Mahou Tsukai no Hako]].

All but [[Saber (fate)|]] are playable in the original [[MELTY BLOOD]] series as of MELTY BLOOD Actress Again, while all but [[Ryougi Shiki]] are playable in [[MELTY BLOOD: TYPE LUMINA]].

As of the [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]] [[Kumano Onsen Satsujin Jiken|collaboration event]], all four have been implemented as servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: mjolnir_(marvel)
body:
[[thor (marvel)|Thor's]] mighty hammer, granting him many superpowers such as weather manipulation (especially casting thunderbolts), flight, energy manipulation, teleportation, etc. It was enchanted so that only the righteous and worthy may wield it and possess the power of Thor (not even Thor himself is exempt from this requirement, and there have been several instances in the comics and related media where he was deemed (temporarily) unworthy).

Unlike most [[war hammer]]s in fiction and real life, this version of Mjölnir more resembles an oversized [[mallet]] with a relatively short handle.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

title: ironmouse_(demon_form)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Ironmouse]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/rosuuri/status/1549167130481917953], debuting first in 2D in May 2021, and then in 3D in November.

Having become a proper [[demon girl|demon]] queen, she now wears a [[pink dress]] with [[short sleeves|short]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[wrist cuffs|pink wrist cuffs]] and [[pink thighhighs|pink]]/[[white thighhighs]] with an [[o-ring thigh strap]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair]] that she wears in [[twintails]] and is decorated with [[heart hair ornament]]s.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8549206: Merchandise

title: melody_(projektmelody)_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] and first Live2D model of [[VShojo]]'s [[Melody (ProjektMelody)|Melody]], debuting in September 2021.

She wears a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]] with a [[purple leotard]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], [[purple gloves|purple]] [[fingerless gloves]] and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels]]. She also has a [[mechanical tail]], a [[thigh strap]], [[purple thighhighs]] and a [[purple choker]].

title: koyanagi_rou
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of the group [[Dytica (nijisanji)|]]. Designed by [[Suou (sdurorhr)|]].

He is portrayed with [[blue hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[grey cape]] with a black [[gradient clothes|gradient]], [[multicolored clothes|two-tone]] [[white shirt|white]] and [[black shirt]], [[undershirt]], [[blue pants]], and black [[boots]]. He also has optional [[uneven horns]] and uses a [[sword]].

title: snifit
body:
[[Shy Guy]]s with nozzles for their mouths extending over their [[mask]]s, which, coupled with their dark colors, look like [[gas mask]]s. Through their protrusions, they can fire projectiles, most commonly [[bullet]]s made from [[nightmare]]s. Snifits were first created for Yume Kojo: Doki Doki Panic, but have been enemies in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] ever since. Snifits usually wear red [[robe]]s, but they also wear grey, green, blue, black, purple, pink, and yellow.

Their Japanese name is "Mūcho".

h4. Official art
* !post #8049736

title: piranha_plant
body:
The [b]Piranha Plant[/b] is a common [[plant]] enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] found in [[Warp Pipe]]s or [[flower pot]]s. Known as [b]Pakkun Flower[/b] in Japan. A potted Piranha Plant appears as a playable fighter in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, debuting in an [i]Super Smash Bros. Ultimate[/i] update after the game's release.

Piranha Plants have [[sharp teeth]] and no eyes, somewhat similar to a [[venus flytrap]]. Most Piranha Plants appear as red with white spots, though many other variants of the Piranha Plant appear throughout the series.

h4. Official art
* !post #8049714

title: fishin'_lakitu
body:
A [[Lakitu]] variant that carries a [[fishing rod]]. It may hang items on the end of the rod.

h4. Official art
* !post #8049697

title: lakitu
body:
A character in the [[mario_(series)|Mario franchise]].  A variant of green-shelled [[Koopa Troopa]] with glasses, or possibly aviator goggles, riding an expressive cloud. Usually seen either throwing [[spiny egg]]s or carrying around various items on the end of a [[fishing rod]]. In the [[Mario Kart]] games they act as track officials: displaying the starting lights at the beginning of the race, waving the [[checkered flag]] at the end, and fishing out racers who land out of bounds.

Called [i]Jugem[/i] in Japanese.

h4. Official art
* !post #8049684

title: nabbit
body:
A recurring character in the [[Mario (series)|]] series that made his first appearance in [[New Super Mario Bros. U]] as an enemy. He is a purple [[rabbit]] with round eyes that always carries around a [[sack]] and wears a white handkerchief similar to [[Bowser Jr.]]'s.
In his debut game, Nabbit may appear on some stages, leaving [[Mario]] and company to chase after him. 
He has also appeared as in other games like [[New Super Luigi U]], his game of origin's [[new_super_mario_bros._u_deluxe|port]], and [[Super Mario Bros. Wonder]] as a playable character, although unable to take damage or use power-ups.

h4. Official art
* !post #7938210  

H4. See also
* "MarioWiki":https://www.mariowiki.com/Nabbit

title: spiny
body: A character in the [[Mario (series)|]] franchise. These turtle-like enemies come with a (typically red) [[turtle shell|shell]] that is studded with spikes, making it dangerous for [[Mario]] and co. to jump on. [[Lakitu]] are known to throw [[Spiny egg]]s, A [[blue shell (mario)|blue version of its shell]] is a notable and infamous item in the [[Mario Kart]] series. h4. Official art * !post #6058557 h4. See Also * [[Spike Top]]

title: turban
body:
The turban is a type of headwear based on cloth winding. Featuring many variations, it is worn as customary headwear primarily by Sikh men and women.

* [[Headscarf]]
* [[Tag group:Headwear]]

title: sekishiro_mico
body:

She is a [[demon girl]] with [[curled horns|curled]] [[brown horns|brown]] [[demon horns|horns]], a [[demon tail]], [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]], and [[yellow eyes|yellow]]-[[blue eyes|blue]] [[heterochromia]].

title: yoshi
body:
The [[dinosaur]]-like creatures appearing in the [[Mario_(series)|Mario]] series since [[Super Mario World]], as well as their own series of games. Has a [[frog]]-like tongue which can be used to swallow enemies and turn them into [[yoshi egg|eggs]] which can be thrown. They also all can rapidly kick their feet to gain more height mid-air, called a Flutter Jump.

They come in a multitude of colors, with green being the default. 

h6. Main Yoshi Colors
* [[Green Yoshi]]
* [[Red Yoshi]]
* [[Blue Yoshi]]
* [[Yellow Yoshi]]
* [[Pink Yoshi]]

* [[Orange Yoshi]]

* [[Blimp Yoshi]]
* [[Bulb Yoshi]]

* [[Yoshi (Egg Hunt)]]

title: lessing_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard operator Lessing, standing in silence.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lessing Mæyer

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 17[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Caprinae[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]175 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]6 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

University student of Prof. [[Fremont (arknights)|]] and friend of [[Ermengarde (arknights)|]].

He fights with a claymore wrapped in bandages, as to avoid hurting others. The bindings on his body tighten his joints and muscles, keeping him focused.

He follows a very strict training regimen and likes to relax by deafeningly playing drums.

He was referred to Rhodes Island by [[Ebenholz (arknights)|]] after the events of [i]Zwillingstürme im Herbst[/i]. [spoiler]He also assists the latter in his effort of rebuilding the territory of Urtica.[/spoiler]

His motif is based on the argali.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Uchida Yuuma]] (Japanese), An Zhi (Chinese), Jesse Grimm (English and German), and Kim Min-ju (Korean).

title: kamek
body:
[i][[mario_(series)|Mario]][/i] character. 

A [[Magikoopa]] closely associated with [[Bowser]]. He often serves as Bowser's advisor, and has doubled as his caretaker throughout the [i][[super_mario_world_2:_yoshi's_island |Yoshi's Island]][/i] series. He has the ability to make enemies grow.

Not to be confused for the Japanese term for the Magikoopa race. 

Since Kamek and Magikoopas have the exact same design, contextual clues are used to determine one or the other. The image most likely has Kamek if:

** The setting is within the [[Yoshi]] franchise or in the past (such as the main characters are their baby counterparts).
** A [u]singular[/u] [[blue_robe|blue-robed]] Magikoopa that is shown to be closely associated with Bowser, [[Bowser Jr.]] or the [[Koopalings]]
** Has the ability to make characters grow in size
** Rides a broomstick (though some generic Magikoopa does this too)

h4. Official Art

title: imaginary_scramble
body:
[b]Concave Illogical Number, Imaginary Trench[br]Great Void Sea Battle, Imaginary Scramble - To the Surface, Nautilus![/b]
[quote]
This is a story a bit before the fifth Lostbelt...

During a Void Space submersion training session in anticipation of the upcoming battle against Kirschtaria, the Nautilus suddenly runs aground on a mysterious object in uncharted waters. During their attempt to escape from Void Space, the crew encounters a castaway who has been adrift on the sea of Imaginary Numbers.

"I'm waiting for you...in the uncharted sea and rainbow dream."

This is the Reverse Side of the World, a realm that has never been observed. Simultaneously the shallowest and deepest pitfall...the closest, furthest underworld in this world.

Who could be calling from the bottomless sea of Imaginary Numbers?
[/quote]
An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] taking place after the events of [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]]. It was released on the Japanese server on November 11, 2020 and on the NA server on October 27, 2022.

title: buzzy_beetle
body:
An enemy from the [[mario (series)|Mario]] series.

They are turtle-like enemies with a powerful shell that resists fire. Some Buzzy Beetles are capable of walking along walls or ceilings, and can drop from ceilings to ambush targets. Buzzy Beetles may have a spike on their shells - these are known as [[Spike Top]]s. Other Buzzy Beetles may have white wings granting them the ability to fly (making them [[Para-Beetle]]s).

Buzzy Beetles are quadripeds. Their legs and underside are yellow, and they typically have bright red or yellow eyes. Their shells are a solid color (typically blue or black, though Spike Tops may have a red shell instead) outside an alternate color on the shell's rim (typically white).

title: lotus_eater
body:
The story of Lotus Eater has been in the works for over seven years, and we have been actively working on the story's art concepts for the past five years.

Lotus Eater: Ruination is the first of six main installments of the Lotus Eater story. From LE:R to the very final installment, each detail has been meticulously planned so that each of the six main arcs are woven together in ways that will make the reader want to revisit each installment again and again as new information comes to light.

Our ultimate goal is to create a Lotus Eater video game series based on our stories. Before that, we plan to distribute each installment as a printed novel, and later possibly as a series of graphic novels.
 
https://www.readlotuseater.com

title: alan_grant
body: Alan Grant is a fictional character in the [[Jurassic Park]] franchise. He is a paleontologist and is introduced in Michael Crichton's 1990 novel Jurassic Park, which began the franchise. Crichton based Grant on the paleontologist Jack Horner who was by happenstance technical advisor for the movies. Director Steven Spielberg helmed the 1993 film adaptation, and several actors were considered for the role of Grant. It ultimately went to Sam Neill, becoming one of his most popular roles. Spielberg gave the character a dislike of children, and put him in a relationship with [[Ellie_Sattler_(jurassic_park)|Dr. Ellie Sattler]], a paleobotanist who is Grant's student in the novel. Sattler, portrayed by Laura Dern, wants to start a family with Grant, who is resistant to the idea.

title: miyafuji_yoshika
body:
Miyafuji Yoshika is the main character of [[Strike Witches]]. She has short [[brown hair]] and wears a [[school swimsuit]] under her blue [[school uniform]]. She is a part of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]]. Her affiliation however is the 288th Fuso Air Force, along with [[Sakamoto Mio]].

Her first [[Striker Unit]] was a A6M3a type Zero with a single yellow stripe as it's identification stripe. Her second unit was the same type (previously owned by Major Sakamoto Mio until she received a new unit based off of the [i]Kawanishi N1K-J [b]Shiden[/b][/i]) with blue stripes on the vertical stabilizer as well as a blue angled stripe that points downward at the front and upward at the back. 

Her third (and current) striker unit is based on the [i]Kyūshū J7W [b]Shinden[/b][/i]. The [i]Shinden[/i] allows Yoshika to use her magic to her fullest potential, as during episode 8 of the anime (Strike Witches 2) her magic became so strong that the governor installed on Mio's striker unit protected the magic engine from overloading.

Her familiar is the [[shiba inu]].

She has been shown to be [[yuri|attracted to other witches' breasts]], especially [[Lynette Bishop]]'s. Because of that she was given a nickname 淫獣宮藤 (injuu miyafuji, lewd/dirty beast Miyafuji).

h4. Equipment

* [[machine gun|13mm Type99-2-2 machine gun]]
* M712

title: raihan_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Raihan[/b], known as [b]Kibana[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

Said to be the strongest Gym Leader in Galar, this Trainer has an easygoing personality that quickly changes to a fiery determination to win once he starts to battle [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Duraludon]].

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[tareme|droopy]] [[aqua eyes]], and [[short hair|short]] [[undercut]] [[black hair]]. He wears an [[orange headband]], [[earrings]], a [[collared shirt]] under a [[black hoodie]], a [[dynamax band]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], [[side slit shorts]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: atlas_gundam
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Thunderbolt]].

[b]RX-78AL Atlas Gundam[/b]

An amphibious land combat mobile suit developed by the [[Earth Federation]] to combat [[Zeon]]s highly dangerous amphibious mobile suits. 

The Atlas Gundam was equipped with a Globe Joint system as well as a powerful handheld railgun, along with the sub-legs system for increased mobility and weapon storage, as well as the heat resistant Blade Shield.

title: act_zaku
body:
A fictional military manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV series from 1985.

[b]MS-11 Act Zaku[/b]

A late development of the original [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]], the purple colored Act Zaku notably used field motors for its joints, rather than the fluid pulse system used by most [[Zeon]] MS. Its joints underwent magnet coating treatment, greatly improving its mobility. Thanks to improved generator output, it was able to use beam weapons, including a custom beam rifle. 

Following the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]], the [[Earth Federation]] began mass producing the Act Zaku now with dark blue colors. The Federation-produced units were equipped with a linear seat cockpit, the BR-87A [[Beam Rifle]] used by the similar looking [[Hizack]], as well as a pair of beam sabers.

title: tendou_michiko
body:
Tendo, a character from the manga series [[Chainsaw Man]] is a tall woman with black hair that is tied back in a messy ponytail with long side bangs reaching past her shoulders.

She tends to wear the standard Public Safety Devil Extermination uniform, and has a horizontal scar across her face—a feature she shares with [[Kurose Yuutarou]].

title: gm_sniper
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGM-79 [G] GM Sniper[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] modification of the [[Ground GM]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] intended for long range fire support. It is equipped with a larger backpack and loaded a massive beam [[sniper rifle]] that could only be fired twice, with a long charging time in between shots, without an external power source. Using that external source, however, the GM Sniper could destroy even a cruiser with a single shot.

h4. See also
* [[GM Sniper Custom]]
* [[GM Sniper II]]
* [[GM Sniper III]]

title: yoshi_egg
body:
Polka-dotted colored [[egg]]s from the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] series. They usually hatch [[Baby Yoshi]]s and [[Yoshi]]s but can also store [[power-up|items]]. 

In some games like [i][[Super Smash Bros.]][/i] and [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i] Yoshis are sometimes shown to have an ability to enter and shield themselves within an egg at will. Since [i][[Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island|Yoshi's Island]][/i] enemies gobbled up by a Yoshi will turn into eggs which can be used as a projectile.

title: koopa_troopa
body:
[[Turtle]]-like enemies from the [[Mario (series)|]] series, with shells that come in many different colors. Flying variants are usually called [[Koopa Paratroopa]]s.

Koopas, along with [[Goomba]]s, are some of [[Mario]]'s most persistent foes. They're common enemies in the Mario series, usually displayed as foot soldiers of the Koopa Troop, under the direct leadership of [[Bowser]]. Since [[Super Mario 64]], however, many Koopas have appeared who do not work for Bowser (or any other villain), some of whom even act as allies to Mario during his adventures.

In Japan, the Troopas are referred to as "Nokonoko".

h4. Official art
* !post #8044258

title: grey_hair
body:
Hair that is colored grey.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment and other factors (such as differences in color displayed on monitors) there is potential overlap between this tag and the [[blue hair]], [[aqua hair]], and [[purple hair]] tags, generally in the lighter shades of those colors. Grey is also often used to shade [[white hair]]. It is a good idea to compare the hair in question to how other white things, namely white clothes, are shaded. If the shading on the hair resembles how white clothing is shaded, it is likely white, and not grey.

h4. Examples

* !post #2356390
* !post #8266685: Dark grey
* !post #7460307: Light grey

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: spike_spiegel
body:
The main character of [[Cowboy Bebop]].

A bounty hunter with an affinity for [i]jeet kune do[/i], he hunts down criminals who escape the grasp of the Inter-Solar System Police (ISSP) with the help of his partner, former Ganymede policeman [[Jet Black]] on the ship known as the Bebop. Spike does not always succeed in getting a bounty, and his penchant for causing massive destruction when in pursuit of a bounty head means that the bounties that he and Jet do get do not last long.

Spike also has a hidden past that involves the Red Dragon, a crime syndicate modeled on the Chinese Triads, and in particular the ruthless assassin known as [[vicious_(cowboy_bebop)|Vicious]]. Also figuring big into Spike's past is the mysterious woman known as [[julia_(cowboy_bebop)|Julia]], who Spike and Vicious both loved.

Spike's weapon of choice is an [[IWI Jericho 941]], and when chasing bounty heads, his vehicle of choice is the [[Swordfish II]], an Asteroid racer outfitted with four machine guns, missile pylons, and a plasma cannon.

Voiced in Japan by Kōichi Yamadera and in America dub by Steven Jay Blum.

title: stocking_(psg)
body:
A character from [[Panty & Stocking With Garterbelt]]

[[panty_(psg)|Panty]]'s younger [[sisters|sister]]. A [[blunt bangs|blunt banged]] [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black-haired]] '[[gothic_lolita|goth loli]]' girl with an appetite for [[sweets|sweet]] desserts. Her stockings can transform into a [[sword]]. Her [[colored inner hair|inner]] [[streaked hair|hair]] is [[pink hair|pink]].

She typically wears a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]], [[black dress]], [[blue ribbon]], [[striped panties]], and [[striped thighhighs]]. Usually holds [[honekoneko (psg)|]].

title: haku_(utawarerumono)
body:
Haku is an amnesiac man found by [[kuon (utawarerumono)|Kuon]]. This encounter will eventually lead him to bond with a certain mercenary named Ukon (actually [[oshtor|Oshutoru]], Imperial Guard of the Right, in disguise) as well as start living in the Imperial Capital of Yamato, where he works as the Secret Agent of the aforementioned Oshutoru [spoilers]and uncovers a conspiracy against the Mikado of Yamato, his long lost brother who somehow significantly extended his lifespan. He is a true human who was sleeping in stasis since shortly before Iceman's wrath and somehow didn't become a Tatari.[/spoilers] 

At the end of Itsuwari no Kamen, [spoilers]he is forced to take Oshutoru's identity after his death and must lead a rebellion to restore Anju (the Mikado's daughter and heiress) as Yamato's Mikado.[/spoilers] At the end of his journey, [spoilers]Haku will find the true instigator of the conspiracy and become the new host of Wistalnemetia.[/spoilers]

He is the protagonist of [[utawarerumono: itsuwari no kamen|Itsuwari no Kamen]] and [[utawarerumono: futari no hakuoro|Futari no Hakuoro]] [spoilers] (in disguise as Oshutoru). [/spoilers]

title: heart_in_eye
body:
When there's a [[heart]] shape inside one's eyes.

Do not mistake with [[heart-shaped pupils]], as the pupils are not actually in heart shape, but with a heart shape inside it.

Do not mistake with [[heart-shaped eyes]], as that implies the entire eye is in the shape of a heart.

title: resident_evil
body:
[b]Resident Evil[/b] (known in Japan as [b]Biohazard[/b] ([b]バイオハザード[/b]) is a media franchise consisting of a survival horror/Biopunk video games series, comic books, novelizations, six Hollywood motion pictures, and a variety of collectibles, including action figures, strategy guides and publications. Developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Shinji Mikami, the game series has been influenced by George A. Romero's [i]Dead[/i] movies.

title: ogata_chieri
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cute (Pink Flower) category. 

Chieri is very shy, but also very hardworking, and also seems to fear being abandoned by the producer. 

Due to her popularity, she was selected for the fifth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shirasaka Koume]], [[Takamori Aiko]], [[Sakuma Mayu]], and [[Anastasia_(idolmaster)|Anastasia]]. Her seiyuu is [[Oozora Naomi]].

title: yenisei_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Yenisei[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. She is one of the protagonist of the "Notes on Shuori" sidestory. A diviner using water as a medium, she and [[Bessmert (Reverse:1999)|Bessmert]] lead an expedition to search for an ancient arcane ritual that can grant wishes, before their team was turned into "horses" and taken away by [[Getian (Reverse:1999)|Getian]].

She is voiced by Alice Malakhov in English and [[Kito Akari]] in Japanese.

body:
[b]Marcus[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is a new field investigator of The Foundation, mentored by [[Greta Hofmann]]. title: donkey_kong
body:
The title character and main villain of the arcade game [[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|]], an early arcade hit for [[Nintendo]].

[[Mario]] has to fend off his barrels to rescue [[Pauline (Mario)|]].

In later games he became a hero, such as in [[Donkey Kong Country]], and is a reoccurring character in the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoff games.

title: arepa
body:
Arepa is a type of food made of ground maize dough, originating from pre-Columbian northern region of South America, and is notable in the cuisines of [[Colombia]] and [[Venezuela]].

It is eaten daily in those countries and can be served with accompaniments such as cheese, cuajada (fermented milk), various meats, chicken, avocado, and diablito. It can also be split to make sandwiches. Sizes, maize types, and added ingredients vary its preparation. Arepas can also be found in the Canary Islands. It is similar in shape to the Mexican gordita and the Salvadoran pupusa.

The word "arepa" comes from the indigenous term "erepa", which means "corn" in the language of the Cumanagoto people.

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* "Wikipedia on Arepa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arepa

title: dr._vegapunk
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The greatest scientist in the world, working for the World Government. He is mentioned multiple times throughout the series before making his first appearance.

[spoilers]To work more efficiently, Vegapunk created clones of himself, so-called satellites, that share his brain and embody a specific aspect of his personality.
The six satellites are:
* [[vegapunk shaka|Shaka]]
* [[vegapunk lilith|Lilith]]
* [[vegapunk edison|Edison]]
* [[vegapunk pythagoras|Pythagoras]]
* [[vegapunk atlas|Atlas]]
* [[vegapunk york|York]]

Vegapunk himself is dubbed "Stella".
[/spoilers]

title: meika_mikoto
body:
Meika [[meika_hime|Hime]] and Mikoto are dual [[Vocaloid]] characters distributed by Gynoid Co., Ltd. They have singing voicebanks for the VOCALOID5 engine and talking voicebanks for [[Gynoid Talk]], both of which were released in March 2019. They were illustrated by [[miwasiba|△○□×]].

Officially, they have [[1other|no set gender]] and are not humans but plum flower spirits. Both have [[horns]] and wear white [[double-breasted]], [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] shirts with red skirts and red/black [[bridal legwear]]. Mikoto has [[blue hair]] and [[pink eyes]] while Hime is reversed with pink hair and blue eyes.

title: meika_hime
body:
Meika Hime and [[meika_mikoto|Mikoto]] are dual [[Vocaloid]] characters distributed by Gynoid Co., Ltd. They have singing voicebanks for the VOCALOID5 engine and talking voicebanks for [[Gynoid Talk]], both of which were released in March 2019. They were illustrated by [[miwasiba|△○□×]].

Officially, they have [[1other|no set gender]] and are not humans but plum flower spirits. Both have [[horns]] and wear white [[double-breasted]], [[sleeveless shirt]]s with [[red skirt]]s and red/black [[bridal legwear]]. Hime has [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]] while Mikoto is reversed with [[blue hair]] and [[pink eyes]].

title: yumemi_nemu_(vocaloid)
body:
Yumemi Nemu is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by Dear Stage (Moe Japan, Co. Ltd.) and distributed by YAMAHA corporation. The software was released for VOCALOID4 in tandem with [[Tone Rion]] V4. Like Tone, her voice is provided by Yumemi Nemu of DEMPAGUMI.Inc. and her design is done by [[Horiguchi Yukiko]].

She has [[short_hair|short]], [[black hair]] and brown eyes. Her clothes, particularly her blue [[letterman jacket]] and white ribbed [[thighhighs]], are [[oversized_clothes|oversized]]. She wears aqua [[shorts]] and shoes. She keeps her jacket [[untucked_shirt|untucked]]. She has the [[tanuki]] as her motif animal.

h4. See also
* [[Tanuqn]] (pet)

h4. External Links
* "Official Site":http://nemurion.com/ (Shared with Tone)
* "Official Profile":http://nemurion.com/nemu/

title: aoki_lapis
body:
Aoki Lapis is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by the YAMAHA Corporation in collaboration with i-style Project, and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. 

She has an older sister named [[merli_(vocaloid)|Merli]], that counters her in theme. Her appearance was illustrated by [[Carnelian]]. She is a tiny [[fairy]] with [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[gem]] on her [[headphones]], a button top and [[skirt]], white [[thigh boots]] and [[half gloves]].

h4. See also
Derivatives of Aoki Lapis

* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "Official site":http://i-style.surpara.com/

title: tone_rion
body:
Tone Rion is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by the YAMAHA Corporation in collaboration with Dear Stage (Moe Japan, Co. Ltd.), and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. The software was updated for VOCALOID4 in 2017, and was subsequently released alongside [[yumemi nemu (vocaloid)|Yumemi Nemu]].

Said to be designed to sell to "moe" and otaku based culture, she is meant to sound cute. She was illustrated by [[Watanabe Akio]]. She has [[purple hair]] (in [[twintails]]) and [[purple eyes]]. Her features show her with a single [[fang]] tooth and [[blush stickers]]. She wears a pink [[maid]]-like outfit, [[necktie]] with jeweled [[choker]], [[fingerless gloves]], [[bracelet]]s, and [[thigh boots]]. She also wears a [[hat]], [[headset]], and a [[large bow|large buttbow]]. 

Her [[tone_rion_(vocaloid4)|V4 redesign]] was done by [[Horiguchi Yukiko]]. This version of her has long [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[cropped_jacket|cropped]] pink [[jacket]] over a pink shirt and [[puffy shorts]]. Her hat is gone, but she still retains her [[headset]]. She wears white [[thigh boots]] over grey [[pantyhose]].

Her motif animal is the [[rabbit]].

Her voice is provided by [[yumemi nemu (dempagumi)|Yumemi Nemu]], a model, actress, DJ, and singer from Dempagumi.inc. 

h4. See also
Derivatives of Tone Rion

* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://tonerion.jp/
* "Official Site (V4)":http://nemurion.com/ (Shared with Yumemi)
* "Official Profile (V4)":http://nemurion.com/rion/

title: utatane_piko
body:
Utatane Piko is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Ki/oon Records, and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Based on [[NicoNico]] singer (and later contracted artists) "PIKO":http://www.nicovideo.jp/mylist/4116804. His appearance was designed by [[YukitA]].  He has [[grey_hair]] with an [[ahoge]], his eyes appear to be [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] ([[green eyes|green]] and [[blue eyes|blue]]). He wears a tube dress with a guitar design, [[detached sleeves]], black [[pantyhose]], and [[boots]]. His accessories are band-less [[headphones]] and a [[usb|usb plug]] as some form of [[tail]].

title: ryuuto_(vocaloid)
body:
Ryuuto is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Licensed as Gachapoid (ガチャッポイド), he is voiced by seiyuu, Amemiya Kuniko. His appearance is based on the beloved green dino [[Gachapin]] of [[Hirake! Ponkikki]]. 

Designed like a young elementary school student, he wears a [[vest]]ed top, stripped [[necktie]], green [[bracer]], [[shorts]], and [[boots]]. He has short [[green hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[buck teeth]]. 

h4. Notice

Do not tag Gacha[b]poid[/b] images as Gacha[b]pin[/b] or with Hirake! Ponkikki unless said character and theme are blatantly present within the image. Same goes for tagging Gachapin as a VOCALOID.

h4. See also
Derivatives of Ryuuto

* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: nekomura_iroha
body:
Nekomura Iroha is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd. in collaboration of AH-Software and [[Sanrio]] company, and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. Her voice provider is the singer Yoshitate Kyounosuke (佳館杏之助).

She is also referred to as a "kittyler" or "kitty'er" and heavily themed in Hello Kitty wear. Her origin stems from the [[Hello Kitty to Issho!]] artists project which started in 2009, she was created and drawn by [[okama]].  Her VOCALOID appearance has her in a red [[bodysuit]] covered in (what appears to be) a [[happi]]. Her shoes are [[sandals]]-like. The notable accessories are her two [[speaker]] gauntlets, and red hello kitty [[helmet]] with [[headphones]]. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

h4. Official art

title: kaai_yuki
body:
Kaai Yuki is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 


Her appearance was illustrated by [[Umetani Atarou]]. She is designed as a young student of [[Hiyama Kiyoteru]]. She has [[black hair]] in [[short twintails]] (held up by [[hair bobbles]]) and her eyes are [[brown eyes|brown]]. She wears a [[red dress]], white [[socks]], and brown [[Mary Janes]]. The instrument she carries in her [[randoseru]] is a  "WIND MIDI CONTROLLER WX5":http://www.yamahasynth.com/products/midi_controllers/wx5/ [[recorder]].

body:
[b]唄音ウタ[/b]
An [[utau|UTAUloid]]. Her nickname is Defoko (デフォ子, meaning "default child") because she is the default voice data bank for the UTAU program. Her voice is not human based, so it sounds robotic and airy.

She wears a purple [[beret]], and has short plum colored hair that comes close to her shoulders and matches her [[necktie]].

title: tsurumaki_maki
body:
Tsurumaki Maki is the second [[Voiceroid]]+ to be released and also the first female voice for the software. She was released on November 12th, 2010. The official name of the product is Tamiyasu Tomoe (民安ともえ) which is the voice provider's name. Tamiyasu Tomoe is a popular voice actress working mainly in adult-oriented games. Maki is the name of the mascot character illustrated in the boxart.

She later received an upgrade with both talking and singing voicebanks under the [[Synthesizer V]] and [[CeVIO]] engines.

From "Voiceroid Wikia":http://voiceroid.wikia.com/wiki/Tsurumaki_Maki

title: touhoku_kiritan
body:
Tohoku Kiritan is a [[VOICEROID]] for a VOICEROID PROJECT by SSS Co., Ltd., the same company that created [[Touhoku Zunko]], an older sister of Kiritan. She was released on October 27, 2016.

Her seiyuu is [[Akaneya Himika]]. Her appearance was illustrated by Ninico Edomura. She has [[black hair|dark]] [[short hair]] (with [[ahoge]]) decorated with [[headgear]], and [[purple eyes|purple]] or [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[short yukata]], red [[obi]], white [[tabi]], and [[geta]].

She and her elder sister [[Touhoku Itako]] are also [[UTAU]] voicebanks. Additionally, she has a more natural-sounding [[neutrino_(software)|NEUTRINO]] voicebank available and a [[CeVIO]] voicebank, too.

h4. External links

* "Unofficial wiki":http://voiceroid.wikia.com/wiki/Tohoku_Kiritan

title: final_fantasy_vii
body:
The seventh JRPG developed by Squaresoft (now [[Square Enix]]) in the [[Final Fantasy]] series, and arguably the most popular game in the series. First released on the Sony [[PlayStation 1|PlayStation]] in 31 January 1997 (after a 3-year hiatus), and then re-released for personal computers in 1998.

The story is about Avalanche, an ecoterrorist organization combating the conglomerate Shinra Electric Power Company which is destroying the world's ecosystem by extracting mako for electricity. One of their latest recruits is acerbic mercenary [[Cloud Strife]], himself a former member of SOLDIER, Shinra's mako-enhanced supersoldier corps. Soon, however, Avalanche would face an even greater enemy in the form of [[Sephiroth]], another former SOLDIER intent on absorbing the planet's power and becoming a god.

A remake, aptly titled [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]], was announced at Sony's 2015 E3 conference. The remake is a multi-game series, the first installment of which was released in April 2020. It would be followed up by [[Final Fantasy VII Rebirth]] in February 2024.

title: adachi_to_shimamura
body:
A light novel series by Iruma Hitoma (入間人間) that centers around the friendship between two high-school girls, [[Adachi Sakura|Adachi]] and [[Shimamura Hougetsu|Shimamura]]. The story outlines their everyday events and contains mild [[yuri]] themes. It began as a series in Vol. 28 of 電撃文庫MAGAZINE (Dengeki Bunko Magazine) in March 2013. Since then, ten volumes have been published by ASCII Media Works with [[Ousaka Nozomi|Non]] (のん) as the illustrator.

There are two manga adaptions; a 3 volume 2013 one illustrated by [b]Mani[/b], which was serialized online via Square Enix's Gangan Online website, and the other, an ongoing adaptation that began in 2019 with illustrations by [[Yuzuhara moke]]. There is also a 12 episode anime adaption by [i]Tezuka Productions[/i] which aired Fall of 2020.

title: gayle_(animal_crossing)
body: Gayle (アリゲッティ, Arigetthī) is a normal alligator villager in the Animal Crossing series. Her name relates to the sounding of the word alligator, her species. Her catchphrase refers to the fact that alligators like to frequently snap and eat things.

title: mizuhashi_parsee
body:
The "Jealousy Beneath the Crust of the Earth".

Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]] and a side character in [[Foul Detective Satori]]. A Persian "Hashihime":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hashihime that has the ability to manipulate jealousy. She lives in the [[bridge]] leading to the underworld, often attempting to drive away anyone who attempts to cross it and losing herself in a jealous rage whenever she fails. Parsee also demonstrates the ability to have a [[clone|copy of herself]] through her spell cards. Often paired with [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]] or [[Kurodani Yamame]] in fanworks due to their stages being next to each other, but also [[Kagiyama Hina]] due to both being stage 2 bosses who deal with negative emotions. 


h4. Appearance
* !asset #23207809

Her appearance is very inconsistent and confusing, leading artists to draw her in a variety of ways. She usually has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[half updo]] or a [[half up braid]], [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]]. Her outfit is a [[white scarf]], and then a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[brown shirt]] over a [[black dress]] but sometimes a separate [[black shirt|black]] [[undershirt]] and [[black skirt|skirt]], a [[white sash]], [[arm warmers]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

h4. See also

* [[paru paru]]: An onomatopoeia for her jealousy
* [[Puru-see (hoshizuki (seigetsu))|Puru-see]]
* "Parsee the Green-eyed Grinch":[/pools/19590]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Parsee Mizuhashi":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Parsee_Mizuhashi

Males wear a [[breastplate]] over [[chainmail]], [[pauldrons]] with a [[cross]], a [[red cape]], [[spiked gauntlets]], a [[black tabard]], a [[black belt]] fastened with the [[Cross of Prontera]], [[leg armor]], and [[armored boots]].
Females wear a [[boobplate]] with a [[cross]], [[pauldrons]], [[spiked gauntlets]], a [[black belt]] fastened with the [[Cross of Prontera]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[armored boots]].

title: abigail_williams_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The eponymous Witch of Salem, she is also known as "The Silver Key" which is a reference to the [[Cthulhu Mythos]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]], worn [[parted bangs|parted]] to both sides and decorated with [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[orange bow|orange]] and [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears a [[black dress]] with [[white bloomers]] and an oversized [[black headwear|black]] [[witch hat]]. Tends to be depicted in oversized clothes with her [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]], or just [[black panties]] with no bra and ribbons (sometimes butterfly-cut ones) coming from the [[multiple bows]] on her neck covering her torso a little.

While using her powers, she gets a [[keyhole]] mark on her forehead, [[white skin]] and [[red eyes]] and can attack with [[tentacles]].

Designed by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]] and voiced by [[Oowada Hitomi]].

h4.Variants

title: nagisa_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[tea_party_(blue_archive)|Tea Party]]. Her full name is Kirifuji Nagisa.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]]. Her usual hairstyle is a [[crown braid]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and decorate with a pair of [[hair flower]]s.

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shrug|white]] [[shrug (clothing)|]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[sailor dress]] with [[long sleeves]] (which gives her [[short over long sleeves]]), a [[white sailor collar]] with a [[black neckerchief]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[pumps]]. She also has a [[chest harness]] with a [[holster]] hanging from it.

Her personal weapon is a [[Walther]] PP [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Hayami Saori]]
Original artist: [[famepeera]] (original design)/[[DoReMi (doremi4704)]] (in-game art)

h4. Appearance

* !post #6082509: Profile

body:
Bonbon is a peppy rabbit villager in the Animal Crossing series. She first appeared in Animal Crossing: New Leaf and has appeared in all subsequent games. Her name may come from the small, round, chocolate confection of the same name, which her head resembles. Her catchphrase also relates to this.

title: animal_crossing
body:
[[Nintendo]]'s life simulation video game series, spanning the [[Nintendo 64]], [[GameCube]], [[nintendo_ds|DS]], [[Wii]], [[nintendo_3ds|3DS]], and [[nintendo_switch|Switch]]. Features player-defined human characters cohabiting a town of anthropomorphic animals.

h4. List of games

title: nanashi_mumei_(emo)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]]. It has an [[emo fashion|emo motif]] (translated into Japanese as punk rock).

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]] with a [[heart choker|heart]] [[pendant choker|pendant]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[print shirt|print]] [[t-shirt]] featuring a variation of her infamous [[Nightmare (nanashi mumei)|"Nightmare" painting]] with a [[torn sweater|torn]] [[black sweater|black]] and [[red sweater|red]] [[striped sweater]] [[sweater under shirt|underneath]], giving her [[short over long sleeves]], an owl [[necklace]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[black belt]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[single kneehigh|single]] [[black socks|black]] [[fishnet socks|fishnet kneehigh]] with a [[white leg warmers|white]] [[leg warmers|leg warmer]] on her right leg and a [[black leg warmers|black leg warmer]] on her left, both depicting her [[mascot]] [[friend_(nanashi_mumei)|Friend]]) and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, both styles are tied with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]], [[hair over one eye|over her right eye]] and a [[huge ahoge]].
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[brown hair]] done in a [[one side up]].
* [[Medium hair]] done in [[twintails]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7259920: Profile (1)
* !post #7259985: Profile (2)

body:
Katt is a big sister cat villager in the Animal Crossing series. She first appeared in [[Animal Crossing: New Leaf]] and has appeared in all subsequent games. She is the only big sister cat in the series. Her name relates to her species. Her catchphrase is a portmanteau of purr and pretty.

title: leif_(animal_crossing)
body:
Leif is a sloth in the Animal Crossing series introduced in Animal Crossing: New Leaf. As a nod to his ownership of the Garden Shop, his name is a pun on the word "leaf." In his main appearances, he runs gardening shops and offers weeding services to the player.

title: leila_(animal_crossing)
body:
Leila is a young turtle in [[Animal Crossing: New Leaf]] who appears on Tortimer Island. She is the daughter of Kapp'n and Leilani, and the granddaughter of Grams. Reflecting her young age, she often substitutes L's and R's with W's when speaking.

It is a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[black coat|black]] [[long coat]] [[coat on shoulders|draped over her shoulders]], a [[two-tone jacket|two tone]] [[black jacket|black]] and [[blue jacket|blue]] [[military jacket]] with a [[two-tone vest|two-tone]] [[black vest|black]] and [[blue vest|blue]] [[waistcoat]] and a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[blue necktie]] and [[mismatched sleeves|mismatched]] [[white sleeves|white]] and [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]] underneath, [[black pants]] with a [[thigh strap]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She also has an [[ear chain]] on her right ear and a [[chain earrings|chain earring]] on her left, [[white gloves]]. The pants' legs are [[detached pants|detachable]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] for this outfit is [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair]] [[two-tone hair]] with [[colored tips]] in a [[wolf cut]], with [[sidelocks]] and her [[hair intakes]] closer together.

title: frillard_(animal_crossing)
body: Frillard, also known as Master Frillard, is a lizard in Animal Crossing: City Folk. He makes his appearances in the Marquee taking Dr. Shrunk's place on rare occasions. He is deep-voiced, like cranky villagers. His name derives from him being a frill-necked lizard.

body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English]]'s [[Ouro Kronii]].

It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[turtleneck]] [[white shirt]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s (although some fans depict it as a [[sleeveless turtleneck]] with [[detached sleeves]] due to her being able to swap her top for a sleeveless turtleneck), [[high-waist pants|high-waist]] [[blue pants|blue]] [[jeans]] that she can swat her jeans with a pair of [[blue shorts|blue]] [[dolphin shorts]], a [[brown coat|brown]] [[trench coat]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]]. She now has a pair of [[ear piercing]]s on her right ear and her [[halo]] is now much smaller and is styled after an electronic clock. She also has an optional [[handbag]] with a [[Boros (Ouro Kronii)|]] [[keyring]] [[bag charm]]. 

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this attire is [[long hair]] is [[hime cut]]-esque  with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[center-flap bangs]] and long [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]], with her [[hair intakes]] being placed closer together.

h4. Appearance

title: shino_(animal_crossing)
body:
Shino is a peppy deer villager in the Animal Crossing series. She was added to Animal Crossing: New Horizons as part of the 2.0 Free Update on November 4, 2021, and she was added to Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp between the announcement and release of the New Horizons update. As of the release of New Horizons, she is the only peppy deer in the series.

She wears a light [[blue kimono]] with a [[green sash]] and is stylized to look like an [[oni]].

title: the_end_(sonic_frontiers)
body:
The final boss of [[Sonic Frontiers]]. The End is the being responsible of destroying the Ancients' home planet, forcing them to flee towards Earth. After it followed them, the Ancients built four Titans to fight it, then seal it inside Cyber Space, a digital dimension. Many ages later, it tricks [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] into liberating it once again, corrupting him in the process.

The End appears before [[Super Sonic]] and [[sage_(sonic)|Sage]] as a [[purple moon|purple]] [[moon]]. On Easy and Normal difficulties, the fight takes place in a quick-time event. On Hard difficulty, Sage must first face it in a shooting section while piloting [[supreme_(sonic_frontiers)|Supreme]].

In the game's Another Story campaign, added in [[sonic_frontiers_the_final_horizon|The Final Horizon]] update, The End will instead take control of Supreme and use it to fight Sonic, who uses the power unlocked from his corruption to grant his transformation a power boost and destroy it.

title: supreme_(sonic_frontiers)
body:
The fourth and last Titan faced by [[Super Sonic]] in [[Sonic Frontiers]]. A large, humanoid entity that wields an [[arm cannon]]. It has a predominantly white and red color scheme, unlike the other Titans' black and grey.

After the battle, Supreme is operated by [[sage_(sonic)|Sage]] to aid [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] on a last stand against [[the_end_(sonic_frontiers)|The End]], a creature weakened and sealed by the Titans ages ago.

In the game's Another Story campaign, added in [[sonic_frontiers_the_final_horizon|The Final Horizon]] update, instead of fighting alone, the End will connect itself to the Titan, making it grow [[extra arms]] and walk on all fours. [[Super Sonic 2|Super Sonic]] must then sever their connection and use his corruption's power to destroy them.

title: sonic_frontiers_the_final_horizon
body: Third and final DLC for [[Sonic Frontiers]], which is a major expansion featuring Another Story, an alternate take on Chronos Island segment and its storyline.

title: riyo_chuchi
body: Riyo Chuchi is a character who debuts in the [[Star Wars]] franchise as a supporting character in the 2008-2020 animated series [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] and then in its spin-off [[Star Wars: The Bad Batch]]. A senator from the planet Pantora, Riyo works in the galactic senate to make the galaxy better.

title: plum_(mario)
body:
A character playable exclusively in [i][[Mario Golf (Nintendo 64)]][/i]. 

Her most distinctive trait is her [[twintails]]. She has [[black hair]] ([[brown_hair|brown]] in-game), [[orange eyes]] ([[red eyes|red]] in-game), a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[polo shirt]] and [[black shorts]]. 

She also makes a cameo in [i]Mario Golf (Game Boy Color)[/i] where she hosts the game's Dictionary, explaining golf terminology.

title: mega_mawile
body:
The [[mega pokemon|Mega-Evolved]] form of [[Mawile]].

Type: Steel/Fairy
Ability: Huge Power
Height: 100 cm / 3'3"
Weight: 23.5 kg / 51.8 lbs

Mega Mawile looks similar to its non Mega-Evolved form, except it has pink colorations and markings on its body (while the markings on its head stay black). It grows over a foot (0.4 meters) in height, becomes more bulky in appearance, and grows a second jaw on its head (with both jaws becoming curved and jagged). In battle, this gives it the ability [b]Huge Power[/b], which effectively (with the slight boost to it base attack from Mega Evolving) gives it the highest attack stat in the entire game. This, along with its Fairy typing, has spawned a multitude of jokes, stating that Mawile is not only a Dragon slayer, but a world destroyer as well.

title: mawile
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #303 in the National PokéDex.
Mawile is known for its deceivingly cute face, its yellow body, its imitation of [[hakama pants]] on its legs, and its most notable feature, a giant set of jaws that rests upon its head. 
It can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Mawile]] with a [i]Mawilite[/i].

Type: Steel/Fairy (Steel prior to [[pokemon xy|Pokémon X/Y]])
Ability: Hyper Cutter / Intimidate (Hidden: Sheer Force)
Height: 60 cm / 2'
Weight: 11.5 kg / 25.4 lbs

Japanese Name: [b]Kucheat[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Sableye]]
Next Pokémon: [[Aron]]

title: harukado_yua
body:
Female main character of [[Yoshibari Aubade]]. 

She is a second year student of senior high school. Yua belongs to the Rhythmic Gymnastics Club of the private Sakakigahara Academy and is one of the "Seven Deadly Sins" in that school, representing "Lust".
Often a victim of [[ryona]] and or [[humiliation]] by her enemies/rivals.

She has been close friends with Haruomi since childhood, but due to a past incident, they limit their closeness to within the home.
After being bitten by a newly transformed vampire Haruomi, she became a failed blood relative, a zombie, and is bound with ropes to suppress her outbursts.

In the sequel novel of [[Yoshibari Aubade]] called "Yoshibari Extra", Yua adopts the identity of the justice heroine "Muse Mask" as part of an undercover mission, wearing an extremely [[revealing clothes|revealing]] and obscene costume. This costume is heavily inspired by [[kekkou_kamen|Kekkou Kamen]], due to its excessive exposure and especially the full head [[mask]].

She also makes an appearance in [[Goddess_defeat:_reincarnation_valanowas|Goddess Defeat: Reincarnation Valanowas]] [女神敗北 転生のヴァラノワ] as a supporting character.

Yua has [[purple_eyes|purple]]/[[pink eyes]], [[large_breasts|large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]], [[pink_hair|pink]] [[hime_cut|hime cut]] hair, sometimes styled with a [[side_ponytail|side ponytail]] or a [[double_bun|double bun]].

h4. Official Art

title: green_yoshi
body:
The most common and main color variant of the [[Yoshi]]s, introduced in [i][[Super Mario World]][/i]. He is the default and most iconic look of the Yoshi species.

He is the best friend and steadfast ally of [[Mario]] with an incredibly friendly, cute and carefree personality. 

In the [[mario_(series)|Mario]] franchise, especially the spinoffs, the Green Yoshi is more likely to be treated as a specific unique individual character rather than a generic member of the Yoshi species.

title: sinclair_hina_(shadowverse_flame)
body:
Hina Sinclair (ヒナ・シンクレア, Hina Sinclair) is a supporting character in [[shadowverse_flame|Shadowverse Flame]].

She has [[multicolored_hair|dual colored hair]] that is [[pink_hair|pink]] and [[black_hair|black]] or perhaps a [[purple_hair|dark purple]] styled in [[twintails]] with two [[antenna_hair|hairs sticking out]] and [[green eyes]]. She usually wears a [[black_dress]] held up by a [[pink_belt]] which ends just above her thighs and leaves her [[bare_shoulders|shoulders bare]] and a green [[crop_top]]. 
[spoiler]She was later revealed to be a part of the seven shadows.[/spoiler]

title: nyarlathotep
body:
[b]Nyarlathotep[/b] is a very powerful and intelligent god-like [[alien]] being character with multiple forms or avatars in the [[Cthulhu Mythos]] known as 'the Crawling Chaos' who loves to meddle into human affairs without directly harming them, but leading them to their doom usually at the hands of other cosmic beings such as [[Azathoth]] [spoilers](his father)[/spoilers]. In essence, he is a master troll.

For the alien female protagonist of the gag series [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]], refer to the [[Nyarlathotep (nyaruko-san)]] tag.

body:
Assassin-class Servant based on the Hindi god of love and one of the [[Matou Sakura|Sakurafaces]], who first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

In-game, Kama is protrayed as an arrogant and sexually provocative goddess, being fully aware that her association with love has led into people associate her with lust as well. However, she is easily flustered when a genuine affection is directed at her.

title: durga_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. One of the two major avatars of the [[Hindu mythology|Hindu]] mother goddess [[Parvati (fate)|]], alongsides [[Kali (fate)|]] (who she transforms into in her third ascension). This form represents Parvati as the "warrior goddess" and the protector of the universe. As with her base form, she uses [[Matou Sakura]] as her vessel.

Designed by [[starshadowmagician]] and voiced by [[Shitaya Noriko]].

title: kali_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant first debuting in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. One of the two major avatars of the [[Hindu mythology|Hindu]] mother goddess [[Parvati (fate)|]], alongside [[Durga (fate)|]] (represented by her first and second ascension). This form represents Parvati as the "goddess of destruction" and patron goddess of the Durga sect of Hinduism, which participated in various kinds of dark magic and esoteric sacrificial/sexual worshipping. As with her base form, she uses [[Matou Sakura]] as her vessel.

Designed by [[starshadowmagician]] and voiced by [[Shitaya Noriko]].

title: grimsley_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Grimsley[/b], known as [b]Giima[/b] (ギーマ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

As an elegant member of the Elite Four and user of Dark-type Pokémon, this risk taker has a good attitude about winning and losing [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Bisharp]].

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[black hair|black]] [[pointy hair]] with [[hair between eyes|long bangs]]. He wears a [[yellow scarf]], a [[white shirt]] under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[tailcoat]] with yellow [[buttons]], [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: need_for_speed
body:
Need for Speed (NFS) is a racing video game franchise published by [[Electronic Arts]]. The first four games in the series were retitled as [b]Over Drivin'[/b] in Japan, before switching to the NFS branding.

The series centers around illicit street racing and in general tasks players to complete various types of races while evading the local law enforcement in police pursuits.

A [[need for speed (2014 film)|live action film]] based on the series was released in 2014.

h4. Entries
* The Need for Speed (1994)
* Need for Speed II (1997)
* Need for Speed III: Hot Pursuit (1998)
* Need for Speed: High Stakes (1999)
* Need for Speed: Porsche Unleashed (2000)
* Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit 2 (2002)
* [[Need for Speed: Underground]] (2003)
* [[Need for Speed: Underground 2]] (2004)
* [[Need for Speed: Underground Rivals]] (2005)
* [[Need for Speed: Most Wanted (2005)|]] (2005)
* [[Need for Speed: Carbon]] (2006)
* [[Need for Speed: ProStreet]] (2007)
* Need for Speed: Undercover (2008)
* Need for Speed: Shift (2009)
* Need for Speed: Nitro (2009)
* Need for Speed: World (2010)
* [[Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit (2010)|]] (2010)
* Shift 2: Unleashed (2011)
* [[Need for Speed: The Run]] (2011)
* [[Need for Speed: Most Wanted (2012)|]] (2012)
* [[Need for Speed Rivals]] (2013)
* Need for Speed: No Limits (2015)
* Need for Speed (2015)
* Need for Speed Payback (2017)
* [[Need for Speed Heat]] (2019)
* [[Need for Speed Unbound]] (2022)

h4. External links
"Official site":https://www.ea.com/games/need-for-speed

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[red eyes]], [[dragon horns]], [[dragon tail|tail]], and [[large breasts]]. Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this attire is [[long hair]] [[colored inner hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and a [[one side up]] with a [[green ribbon|green]] [[hair ribbon]].

title: hoshimachi_suisei_(school_uniform)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]].

It's a [[school uniform]]-themed outift and comes in 2 versions:
* A [[white serafuku]] consisting of  a [[grey cardigan|grey]] [[aran sweater|aran cardigan]], a [[blue choker]], a [[white shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]] with a [[white dress]] underneath, a [[blue bowtie]] and a [[blue belt]].
* A [[black serafuku]] consisting of a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[cat hood|cat ears]], a [[black choker]], a [[black shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]] with a [[black dress]] underneath, a [[yellow bowtie]] and a [[grey belt]].

In both versions the shirt has [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[star brooch]] holding the bowtie, the dress is a [[pleated dress|pleated]] and [[medium dress|knee-length]], and both have [[white socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]], she also wears [[pearl earrings]] on both versions.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] in a [[half updo]] with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]].

title: nolan_grayson
body: Nolan Grayson is a fictional character in the Image Universe, created by writer Robert Kirkman and artist Cory Walker (with Ryan Ottley) as an expansion of a character concept created by Alan Moore and Chris Sprouse. Omni-Man is the father of [[mark grayson|Invincible]] and Oliver Grayson, and a member of the alien Viltrumite race, working as a superhero on Earth. Omni-Man appears in Supreme, Invincible, Noble Causes, and Dynamo 5.

title: karen_mccormick
body: Character from [[South Park]], Karen McCormick is the youngest member of the McCormick family. She first appears as a background character in "Best Friends Forever". She later appeared in "The Poor Kid", where she played her first major role. Kenny is very protective of her, using his identity, Mysterion, to comfort her in hard times and keep her out of danger. Kenny's protectiveness as Mysterion extends to such a degree that she considers him her "guardian angel".

title: wendy_testaburger
body: Wendy Testaburger is a major-supporting character and the most prominent female character on [[South Park]]. She is the most prominent of the female classmates of [[stan marsh|Stan]], Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny, as well as Stan's on-and-off girlfriend. Wendy is a female fourth-grade student at South Park Elementary. She made her official first appearance and first official speaking role in the Season One episode "Cartman Gets an Anal Probe". Wendy has been voiced by four people during the series' run: Mary Kay Bergman, Mona Marshall, Eliza J. Schneider and currently April Stewart.

title: frozen_(disney)
body:
An American animated musical fantasy film produced by [[Disney|Walt Disney Animation Studios]] and originally released in 2013. Its plot follows a young girl named [[Anna (Frozen)|]] who, accompanied by an iceman named [[Kristoff (Frozen)|]] and an anthropormorphic snowman named [[Olaf (Frozen)|]], attempts to find her estranged sister Elsa after she accidentally freezes the kingdom of Arendelle in an eternal winter with her ice powers. 

In 2019, the film was followed by a sequel, [i][[Frozen II (disney)|]][/i].
