Worked as a DJ and occasionally a producer thanks to her looks and her boyfriend" influence in Yokohama's night life. She drives a first gen [[Mazda RX-7 FD]], that had been modified using actuator driven variable length intake system - something akin to what 7878 uses in their engine - that keeps the power band alive in every RPM. title: kurapika
body:
One of the main characters from [[Hunter x Hunter]].

A Blacklist Hunter and member of the Kurta Clan, being the only remaining member so far, Kurapika vows to avenge his fallen clan by destroying the Phantom Troupe after the latter massacred his clan for their "Scarlet Eyes", thus being his ultimate goal in becoming a Hunter.

He is usually calm, smart, and reticent, but becomes more wrathful and callous when threatened, attributing to his tragic past. This makes him impulsive sometimes, despite doing so for the sake of protecting his friends and avenging his clan.

Voiced by [[Hidaka Noriko]] (Pilot OVA), [[Kaida Yuki]] (1999), [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (2011), and [[Erika Harlacher]] (2011; EN).

h4.Appearance
Kurapika has an [[androgynous]] appearance. He is a short [[blonde hair|blonde haired]] young man with [[brown eyes]] which turn [[red eyes|scarlet red]] in some occasions. His outfit is usually a [[tabard]] with reddish hem and a white [[white shirt|shirt]] and [[white pants|pants]]. His footwear is a blue-colored [[flats]].

title: class_d51
body:
The Class D51 (D51形) is a type of 2-8-2 [[steam locomotive|steam]] [[locomotive]] built by the [[Japan Railways|Japanese Government Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JGR]]), the [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JNR]]), and Kawasaki Heavy Industries Rolling Stock Company, Kisha Seizo, Hitachi, Nippon Sharyo, Mitsubishi, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries from 1936 to 1945 and 1950 to 1951. 174 units are in preservation in Japan, including five operational examples. A further 13 are preserved in Russia and Taiwan, bringing the total number of preserved units to 187.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23073815: D51 Steam Locomotive
* !asset #23073832: D51 in freight operation of the JNR days
* !asset #23073836: D51 "Namekuji"(Slug) Variant
* !post #6834291: Goto Factory Smoke Deflector 

h4. See also

* [[West Japan Railway Company]]
* [[Steam Locomotive]]

title: beast_boy_(dc)
body: Beast Boy (Garfield Mark "Gar" Logan) is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. He has also gone under the alias Changeling. Created by writer Arnold Drake and artist Bob Brown, he is a shapeshifter who possesses the ability to transform into any animal he chooses. The character first appeared in Doom Patrol #99 (November 1965) and is usually depicted as a member of the Doom Patrol and the [[Teen Titans]].

title: tsukino_mito_(20th_costume)
body:
The 20th costume of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Tsukino Mito]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://x.com/MitoTsukino/status/1855928468959097037]. 

It follows a "gothic witch" theme, featuring a [[witch hat]], a [[layered dress]] and a [[black cape]]. Her hair is done into long [[twin braids]].

title: ganesha_(mythology)
body:
In [[Hindu mythology]], [b]Ganesha[/b] (or [b]Ganesh[/b]) is the [[elephant]]-headed god of arts, knowledge, and willpower. He is one of the most well-known Hindi gods and is widely worshipped in several Hindu sects. In most traditions, Ganesha is the son of [[Shiva (mythology)|]] and [[Parvati (mythology)|]].

In most traditions, the story of how Ganesha got his elephant head usually revolves around how his father Shiva accidentally beheaded him either by his earth-scorching third eye or his [[chakram]] and used an elephant's head as a replacement. Another story says that Shiva found Ganesha too alluring, so he gave him an elephant head and [[fat|large belly]] to prevent future trouble.

title: kyu-kurarin_(cevio)
body:
A song created by the VOCALOID producer [[iyowa_(igusuri_please)|iyowa]], sung by [[kafu_(cevio)|KAFU]].

The title means something like an urgent feeling of dizziness or vertigo (きゅう - urgent, くらり - feeling of dizziness). Another potential reading could be a sudden and swift change in everything (きゅう - sudden, くらり - situation in which there is a sudden and large change in things). 

h4. See also

* [[Kurari-chan_(iyowa)|]] - The girl featured in the MV

title: close-quarters_combat
body:
[b]CQC[/b] ([b]Close-Quarters Combat[/b]) is a system of combined combat techniques which allow rapid alternation between armed and hand-to-hand combat while engaging enemy personnel. 

In the typical CQC stance, the user holds their [[gun]] (a one handed weapon such as a [[handgun]]) with their dominant hand while supporting it with the other hand, which holds their CQC [[knife]]. By using this stance, the gun remains steady for accurate engagement of opponents outside the range of unarmed combat, while allowing a quick transition to the knife for close-work. 

In the [[metal gear solid|Metal Gear Solid universe]] it's a style of close combat techniques developed together by [[The Boss]] and [[Big Boss]] of [[Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater]]. 


Use this tag for when a character in the picture is wielding a gun and a knife.

h4. See also

* [[Dual wielding]]

title: basic_instinct_(movie)
body: A 1992 neo-noir, erotic thriller Western film directed by Paul Verhoeven. It follows police detective Nick Curran (played by Michael Douglas) on a serial murder case, who gets sexually involved with the prime suspect, Catherine Tramell (played by Sharon Stone), a cunning and manipulative author. The film is famous and infamous for its overt depictions of sex and violence, which were highly explicit for its time. It's most famous for its interrogation scene, in which Tramell intentionally flashes herself while switching [[crossed legs]] in her seat.

title: flint_(arknights)
body:
[i]Flint, a tribal warrior, is the pure embodiment of power.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real name: Kemar

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Sargon[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 17[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]144 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]15 years (Self-reported)[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A Sargon tribal warrior from the jungle of Acahualla, she joined Rhodes Island on [[Blaze (arknights)|]]'s recommendation.

She comes from a Liberi tribe of smaller stature and frailer constitution, as such she wants to challenge stronger people in order to mold and improve herself, until she can beat them with her [[boxing gloves]].

She likes lushly colored flowers and gives a hand at [[Perfumer (arknights)|]]'s greenhouse.

Her motif is based on the white-necked jacobin.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Yamamura Hibiku (voice actor)|]] (Japanese), and Hou Xiaofei (Chinese). Her art designer is [[aZLing]]

h4. Skins
* !post #4067339: Default
* !post #4067340: Elite II
* [[flint (gorgeous flower) (arknights)|Gorgeous Flower]]
other_names: フリント(アークナイツ)

title: taoist_rope
body:
The "Daoist/Taoist":[/wiki_pages/taoism] robe (道袍) is a traditional garment worn by Daoist practitioners, symbolizing their spiritual beliefs and cultural heritage. These robes are typically long and flowing, crafted from silk or cotton, and often adorned with symbols such as the "Eight Trigrams (bagua, 八卦)":[/wiki_pages/bagua] or "Yin-Yang (阴阳)":[/wiki_pages/yin_yang] to reflect Daoist philosophy. Designed for both ritual and daily use, they emphasize simplicity, harmony, and the connection between humans and nature, key tenets of Daoism. The robes vary in color and design, with different styles signifying the wearer's role, sect, or spiritual attainment.

h4. See also

* [[Taoism]]

title: shiki_eiki
body:
The "Highest Judge of Paradise", final boss and a playable character of [[Touhou]]'s [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

A "yama":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yama responsible for judging the souls of the dead, having the ability to identify good and evil. She is best known, however, for being quite moralistic and calling out other characters on their faults - more so (sometimes with physical punishment) upon her errant shinigami, [[Onozuka Komachi]]. Based on her illustration from "The Grimoire of Marisa", fanworks often comically depict her as rather petite and [[flat chest|flat-chested]] compared to her imposing, busty employee - something which angers Eiki - though a full-figured woman with long legs and [[zettai ryouiki]] is another depiction often used in fanart. Canon is inconsistent on which form is true, with some speculation that the child depiction is used as an alternate form for reasons unknown.

Yamaxanadu (ヤマザナドゥ) is her title (meaning "Yama of Paradise"), but has led fans to erroneously read her name as "Shikieiki Yamaxanadu". In actuality, her given name is Eiki and her surname is Shiki.

h4. Appearance 
* !asset #24008538
* !asset #24008536: Grimoire of Marisa

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] often cut [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrically]] and either [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[frilled hat|frilled]] [[blue hat]], a [[blue vest]] with [[buttons]] and a [[ribbon-trimmed vest|ribbon trim]] and [[epaulettes]], a [[white shirt]] with [[red bow|red]] and [[white bow]]s [[sleeve bow|on]] its [[long sleeves|sleeves]], a [[black skirt]] also with a [[ribbon-trimmed skirt|ribbon trim]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. She is often seen [[holding]] her [[rod of remorse]] or a red [[spider lily]].

h4. See also

* [[Enma (mythology)]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Eiki Shiki, Yamaxanadu":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Eiki_Shiki,_Yamaxanadu
other_names: 四季映姫・ヤマザナドゥ

* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]
* [[Tag group:Hair styles]]

title: hair_down
body:
An [[alternate hairstyle]] where a character who normally wears their hair "up" is drawn wearing their hair "down".

For example, a character who normally wears [[twintails]] or a [[ponytail]] drawn without twintails or a ponytail.

For characters with short hair having their hair grown longer "down", use [[alternate hair length]] or [[official alternate hair length]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #642362: [[Hiiragi Kagami]] normally wears [[twintails]]
* !post #1936138: [[Tainaka Ritsu]] normally wears a [[hairband]]

h4. See also

* [[Alternate hairstyle]]
* [[Hair up]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair styles]]

title: dotted_half_note
body:
A [[half note|half]] [[musical note|note]] that has at least one dot placed to the right of it. The dot denotes that the note's length is increased by half of its original value. In general, a note can have up to three dots. Subsequent dots add progressively halved value.

Not to be confused with [[staccato]], where the dot is placed above or below a note.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23352310

h4. See also

* [[half note]]
* [[half rest]]

title: dotted_eighth_note
body:
An [[eighth note|eighth]] [[musical note|note]] that has at least one dot placed to the right of it. The dot denotes that the note's length is increased by half of its original value. In general, a note can have up to three dots. Subsequent dots add progressively halved value.

Not to be confused with [[staccato]], where the dot is placed above or below a note.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23352597
* !asset #23352598: [[beamed eighth notes|Beamed]] dotted eighths notes

h4. See also

* [[eighth note]]
* [[beamed eighth notes]]
* [[eighth rest]]

* "Wikipedia: Dotted note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dotted_note
* "Wikipedia: Eighth note":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eighth_note

title: bait_and_switch
body:

title: franka_(arknights)
body:
[i]Franka, Guard Operator of B.P.R.S. of Blacksteel, is waiting for your orders.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td][[fox girl|Vulpo]][/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A biohazard protection and response specialist for [[Blacksteel Worldwide (arknights)|]] (BSW), and is very experienced and proficient in VIP protection, raid, and combat support operations. She is currently undergoing treatment at Rhodes Island while providing professional security.

Regularly shown bickering with and poking fun at her partner, fellow BSW Operator [[liskarm (arknights)|Liskarm]].

Uses a thermite rapier and a dagger as her preferred weapon.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kakuma Ai]] (Japanese), Vila (Chinese), Maya Aoki Tuttle (English), and Park Ko-woon (Korean). Her original art designer is [[renatus.z|TOKI]], while her new outfit was designed by [[usu (9619usu)| usu]].

title: mirko
body:
A character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. A professional hero with "rabbit" quirk, granting her various rabbit-like abilities such as immensely strong legs, capable of jumping at a great height, and superhuman hearing ability. Her civilian name is [b]Usagiyama Rumi[/b]. 

She is depicted as a [[dark skin|dark skinned]] or [[tan|tanned]], [[toned|athletic]] [[rabbit girl]] (albeit her fanart frequently depicted her with [[muscular female|muscular]] body instead) with [[white hair|white]], [[long hair]]. While under hero duties, she wear a [[white leotard]], which when combined with her organic rabbit ears and tail can make it appears as if she's wearing a playboy bunny outfit.

Mirko was named after Mirko "Cro Cop" Filipovich, a now retired [[mixed martial arts]] fighter and Kickboxer, best known for competing in [[Pride Fighting Championships]] and the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]].

Due to a localization error, "Mirko" is sometimes inappropriately spelled as "Miruko". When he was fighting in Japan, "Mirko" had to be translated as "Miruko/ミルコ" as Japanese does not have an independent "R" sound (the kanji らりるれろ are roughly pronounced ra-ri-ru-re-ro). Western manga translators who did not know the reference unintentionally retranslated the faulty original translation.
other_names: ミルコ(僕のヒーローアカデミア)

title: gojou's_imaginary_technique
body:
[[Gojou Satoru]]'s Hollow Purple technique, combining the attracting force of Lapse: Blue and the repulsive force of Reversal: Red to create a sphere of imaginary mass that effectively erases all it comes in contact with, from [[Jujutsu Kaisen]]. 

A common [[scene reference]] from his second fight with [[Fushiguro Toji]], it's most often used to parody a character's strongest attack, or simply elevate a tonal shift from something comedic to extremely serious, a la mimicking [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s [[araki hirohiko (style)|style]].

* !asset #23417061

title: forsaken_(world_of_warcraft)
body:
Forsaken is a Playable race of World of Warcraft.

The features of the dead resurrected as Forsaken are mainly reflected in their [[pale skin]] and uniformly [[yellow_eyes|yellow pupils]].

The Forsaken are a type of undead race, different from the Scourge and the Ebon Blade. They have the same emotions and willpower as they did in life.

They once served [[sylvanas_windrunner|Sylvanas]], and now they serve [[calia_menethil|Menethil]].

This race belongs to the [[horde_(world_of_warcraft)|Horde]] faction.

External Link: 
* "Forsaken (Lore)":[https://warcraft.wiki.gg/wiki/Forsaken]

title: cirno
body:
"The Small Ice Fairy"

Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[ice wings]], and wears a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She appears in [[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]] as a playable character, "[[Tanned Cirno]]."

An ice fairy living in the [[Misty Lake]], near the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]. A relatively weak fighter, but nevertheless claims to be the strongest of all (somewhat justified, as fairies are low-tier generic enemies in the series). One of her hobbies is [[frozen|freezing]] [[frog|frogs]] and watching them thaw (a third of which ends up shattering), leading doujins to portray her at odds with the frog-themed goddess [[Moriya Suwako]].

Her large ego and childish incompetence earned her the nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]" (pronounced "maru kyuu"/"nine-ball"), based on an "elements of play" screenshot from the game manual of [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] in which she was labelled 「9.バカ」 ("baka"/"idiot"). Another contributing factor to her portrayal as an idiot is her [[Icicle Fall]] spell card from Embodiment of Scarlet Devil, which (on Easy difficulty only) fails to hit a "safe zone" directly beneath/in front of her. Doujins also portray her as de facto leader of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] (also known as the "baquartet"), a posse of "insignificant" Touhou characters.

In Russian she is known as [i]Сырно[/i] (Sɨrno), which literally translates as "cheesy" (in adverb form). In Finnish she is known as [i]Sirkku[/i] (post #673220).

h4. See also

* [[Circled 9]] (⑨)
* [[Cirno Day]] (9th September)
* [[Cirno-nee]], an [[aged up]], much more mature rendition
* [[Advent Cirno]], a series depicting her in the style of [[Cloud Strife]] of [[Final Fantasy VII]]
* [[Achi Cirno]], a fire-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Ikazu Cirno]], a lightning-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Mizu Cirno]], a water-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Hapa Cirno]], a leaf-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Tanned Cirno]], as she appears in [[Hidden Star In Four Seasons]]
* [[Nineball=Cirno]], a [[M.U.G.E.N]] character which changes Cirno's color palette to match [[Armored Core]]'s [[Nineball Seraph]]
* pool #1567: Cirno - ⑨⑨⑨x⑨⑨⑨ (Cirno images with dimensions exactly 999x999)
* pool #4616: Cirno Is Not So ⑨ (Cirno portrayed as smarter or cleverer than usual)

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Cirno":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Cirno

title: starry_sky_print
body:
When something, usually an article of clothing, has such a print that it resembles a [[starry sky]].

A regular motif among pixiv's female userbase, it is often used by both new artists and well-known artists. The 星空ドレス (starry dress) tag is often used on pixiv to indicate a [[dress]] with a starry sky print on it, although at other times it may also refer to a [[leotard]], [[skirt]], [[coat]], or other article of clothing.

h4. Notable characters with this trait
* [[Ultimate Madoka]]
* [[Reiuji Utsuho]]
* [[Rosalina]]
* [[Shadow Queen]]

h4. See Also

* [[space print]], a subset of this tag for more elaborate prints featuring celestial bodies other than stars

h4. External links

title: tunguska_sanctuary_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Anti-Primate Biosphere, Tunguska Sanctuary[/b]
[quote]
After escaping the mayhem of the Sixth Lostbelt, Koyanskaya began to quietly but determinedly rebuild her strength. An urgent communication from Sion alerts Chaldea to the threat Koyanskaya poses, and they begin working on a plan to defeat her.

The decisive battle will take place at the headwaters of the Tunguska River in Russia, the final forest sanctuary of living things on the bleached earth. There, Master must fight to put an end to the cycle of hatred...
[/quote]

An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] after the events of [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]]. It was released on the Japanese server on December 22, 2021, and on the NA server on December 22, 2023.

title: chris_(konosuba)
body:
[b]Chris[/b] is a female character in the [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!|KonoSuba]] series. She is a thief and a member of the Eris Church who teaches [[satou_kazuma|Kazuma]] many thief skills and was [[darkness_(konosuba)|Darkness's]] first adventuring companion. She is a good friend of both Darkness and Kazuma.

Chris is a teenage girl with a light complexion and [[purple eyes]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair|silver/grey hair]] and two strands of hair ([[sidelocks]]) framing her face with a piece of hair pointing out from her fringe ([[side ahoge]]). She also has a [[scar on cheek|scar]] on her right cheek. Most likely due to her tomboyish and outgoing nature, along with her [[small breasts|small]] (almost [[flat chest|flat]]) chest and short hair, she is often mistaken for a boy.

Chris usually wears a fairly revealing outfit. Her outfit consists of a light blue ([[aqua scarf|aqua]]) [[scarf]], a short [[green cape]] which goes down to her elbows, a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] with normal [[brown gloves]] layered over them, [[short shorts|short]] [[denim shorts|blue jean-shorts]], [[white thighhighs]] with a [[blue trim|blue trimming]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], and a bikini-like grey [[crop top|top]]. [spoiler]Ever since her first run-in with Kazuma, Chris has worn [[black leggings]] in case her [[panties]] are stolen again.[/spoiler] She also wears diamond-shaped blue [[earrings]] and usually has an enchanted [[dagger]] fastened to her waist on her back.

[spoiler]She is, in truth, the goddess [[eris_(konosuba)|Eris]] in mortal disguise.[/spoiler]

title: eric_cartman
body: Eric Theodore Cartman, commonly referred to as just Cartman, is a fictional character in the adult animated sitcom [[South Park]], created by Trey Parker and Matt Stone. He is voiced by Parker, and is one of the series' four main characters, alongside [[Stan Marsh]], [[Kyle Broflovski]], and [[Kenny McCormick]]. He first appeared with the name Kenny in the short film The Spirit of Christmas (1992), and later appeared in the 1995 film of the same title before debuting in "Cartman Gets an Anal Probe", the first episode of the series, on August 13, 1997.
other_names: エリック・カートマン

title: kyle_broflovski
body: Kyle Broflovski is a fictional character in the adult animated sitcom [[South Park]]. He is voiced by and loosely based on series co-creator Matt Stone. Kyle is one of the series' four central characters, along with his friends [[Stan Marsh]], [[Kenny McCormick]], and [[Eric Cartman]]. He debuted on television when South Park first aired on August 13, 1997, after having first appeared in The Spirit of Christmas shorts created by Stone and long-time collaborator Trey Parker in 1992 (Jesus vs. Frosty) and 1995 (Jesus vs. Santa).

Stan is one of the series' four central characters, along with [[Kyle Broflovski]], [[Eric Cartman]], and [[Kenny McCormick]]. He debuted on television when South Park first aired on August 13, 1997, after having first appeared in The Spirit of Christmas shorts created by Parker and long-time collaborator Matt Stone in 1992 (Jesus vs. Frosty) and 1995 (Jesus vs. Santa).

title: chef_(south_park)
body: Chef Jerome McElroy, often referred to as just "Chef", is a fictional character on the Comedy Central series [[South Park]] who was voiced by Isaac Hayes. A cafeteria worker at the local elementary school in the town of South Park, Colorado, Chef is generally portrayed as more intelligent than the other adult residents of the town, and understanding to the children. His advice is often sought by the show's core group of child protagonists —[[Stan Marsh]], [[Kyle Broflovski]], [[Eric Cartman]], and [[Kenny McCormick]] — as he is the only adult they completely trust. He frequently gives completely honest advice without considering whether it is appropriate for children, usually in the non sequitur form of a lascivious soul song.

title: longinus_(weapon)_(fate)
body:
A [[spear]] named after its original wielder, [[Lucius Longinus (fate)|]]. It was an ordinary spear until it stabbed the side of [[Jesus|Jesus Christ]] during his [[crucifixion]] and became a holy relic due to being coated in the messiah's blood. It would later be wielded by [[Percival (Fate)|]] and become one of his noble phantasms.

[spoiler]In the British lostbelt, [[Aesc (fate)|]]'s [[Staff of Selection (fate)|Spear of Selection]] transformed into a Longinus look-alike after it was gifted to the Lostbelt version of Percival by [[Aurora (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

title: richard_wagner
body: Wilhelm Richard Wagner was a [[germany|German]] composer, theatre director, essayist, and conductor who is chiefly known for his operas.

title: johann_sebastian_bach
body: Johann Sebastian Bach (31 March [O.S. 21 March] 1685 – 28 July 1750) was a [[germany|German]] composer and musician of the late Baroque period. He is known for his prolific output across a variety of instruments and forms, including orchestral music such as the Brandenburg Concertos; solo instrumental works such as the cello suites and sonatas and partitas for solo violin; keyboard works such as the Goldberg Variations and The Well-Tempered Clavier; organ works such as the Schubler Chorales and the Toccata and Fugue in D minor; and choral works such as the St Matthew Passion and the Mass in B minor. Since the 19th century Bach Revival, he has been generally regarded as one of the greatest composers in the history of Western music.

title: alex_delarge
body:
Protagonist of the novel and movie [[a_clockwork_orange|A Clockwork Orange]].
He loves violence, rape and classical music (that of [[Ludwig van Beethoven]] above all), and peppers his phrases with a made-up slang called Nadsat. He couldn't care any less about the consequences of his behavior... until they start catching up to him after a while, in much unpleasant ways for him.
other_names: アレックス・デラージ

title: san-chan
body: San-chan is a [[Large_breasts|busty]] [[dragon_girl|dragon girl]] from [[Raisei_no_ryu_tsukai|Raisei no Ryu Tsukai]].

title: a_clockwork_orange
body:
A 1971 crime film directed by [[Stanley Kubrick]]. Based on the 1962 novel of the same name.
It employs disturbing and violent themes to comment on psychiatry, juvenile delinquency, youth gangs, and other social, political, and economic subjects in a dystopian near-future Britain.
other_names: 時計じかけのオレンジ

title: tie_bomber
body: The TIE/sa bomber, formally known as the TIE Surface Assault Bomber and also known as the TIE/sa tactical bomber or simply the TIE bomber, was a bombing variant of the TIE fighter series used by the Galactic Empire in the [[Star Wars]] series. An evolution of the TIE/gt, the TIE bomber was their main source of anti-emplacement air-support. They were nicknamed "dupes" by the New Republic pilot Wyl Lark.

title: spider-man_(2099)
body: Spider-Man 2099 is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The character was created by Peter David and Rick Leonardi in 1992 for the Marvel 2099 comic book line, and he is a futuristic re-imagining of the original [[Spider-Man]] created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko. His true identity is Miguel O'Hara, an Irish-Mexican geneticist living in Nueva York (a renamed New York City) in the year 2099 who attempts to re-create the abilities of the original Spider-Man in other people and later suffers a related accident that causes half of his DNA to be rewritten with a spider's genetic code.

title: guatemala
body: Guatemala, officially the Republic of Guatemala, is a country in Central America. It is bordered to the north and west by [[Mexico]], to the northeast by Belize, to the east by Honduras, and to the southeast by El Salvador. It is hydrologically bordered to the south by the Pacific Ocean and to the northeast by the Gulf of Honduras.

title: hand_on_own_chin
body:
When a character has one of their hands on their own [[chin]]. Typically signify that the character is either in [[thinking|deep thought]] or [[bored]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own chin]].

h4. See also

* [[head rest]]
* [[stroking own chin]]
* [[finger to own chin]]
* [[hand on another's chin]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_chin
body:
When a character touches the [[chin]] of another character.

h4. See also

* [[grabbing another's chin]]
* [[stroking another's chin]]
* [[hand on own chin]]

title: travis_grady
body:
The protagonist of [[Silent Hill: Origins]], the fifth installment in the [[Silent Hill (series)|]] series.
He is a troubled and lonely truck driver with a dark past. Travis is running late on a delivery to Brahms and decides to take a shortcut through the town of Silent Hill. In doing so, he remembers the horrible tragedies that took place years ago, as well as digging into a religious conspiracy regarding a cult known as the Order occurring within the town.

title: god_(silent_hill_3)
body: The god, also simply called God, is the final boss of [[Silent Hill 3]], encountered at the end of the chapel. She is the result of a partly-failed ritual to resurrect the deity of the town's religion.

title: numb_body_(silent_hill)
body: Numb Body is a monster from [[Silent Hill 3]]. They also appear in Silent Hill: The Arcade and the comics Dying Inside and Hunger.

title: douglas_cartland
body: Douglas Cartland is a character appearing in [[Silent Hill 3]]. He is a middle-aged private detective who was hired by Claudia Wolf, a cult leader, to locate [[Heather Mason]] and bring her to Silent Hill.

title: silent_hill_1
body: Silent Hill is a 1999 survival horror game developed by Team Silent, a group within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, and published by Konami. As the first installment in the [[silent hill (series)|Silent Hill]] video game series, the game was released exclusively for the PlayStation. Silent Hill uses a third-person view with real-time rendering of 3D environments. To mitigate the limitations of the console hardware, developers used fog and darkness to obscure the graphics and hide pop-ins, which, in turn, helped establish the game's atmosphere and mystery. Unlike earlier survival horror games that focused on protagonists with combat training, the player character of Silent Hill is an "everyman".

title: shining_ultraman_zero
other_names: シャイニングウルトラマンゼロ

title: feena_(ys)
body:
One of the twin goddesses of the [[Ys]] series. Appears in the [[Ancient Ys Vanished]] duology and their distant prequel [[Ys Origin]].

Her older twin sister is [[Reah (Ys)|]]. Feena can be distinguished by her more noticeable [[curtained hair]] and/or distinctly [[parted bangs]].

title: reah_(ys)
body:
One of the twin goddesses of the [[Ys]] series. Appears in the [[Ancient Ys Vanished]] duology and their distant prequel [[Ys Origin]].

Her younger twin sister is [[Feena (Ys)|]]. Reah can be distinguished by her longer bangs that occasionally go [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

title: emma_sheen
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985.

[spoiler]A former [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] cadet and later [[GM Quel]] operator who defects to the [[AEUG]] after witnessing the Titans brutal methods, [b]Emma Sheen[/b] becomes the pilot of a [[Rick Dias]], the [[Gundam Mk II]] as well as its [[Super Gundam]] variant. Emma dies in [[Kamille Bidan]]'s arms at the final battle of the Gryps conflict, just after being mortally wounded by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]].[/spoiler]

title: sparse_pubic_hair
body:
[[Pubic hair]] that is particularly light, thin, whispy, or groomed in such a way as to be of minimal area or volume compared to that of typical, natural pubic hair.

This tag is the opposite extreme of [[excessive pubic hair]].

h4. Examples

title: earth_federation_space_forces
body:
A fictional [[military]] organization from the [[Gundam]] series.

It is the [[space]] [[war|combat]] specialist divisional forces of the [[Earth Federation]].

h4. See also
* [[char's_counterattack|Londo Bell]] -  A notable EFSF squadron [spoiler]formed from the remains of the [[AEUG]] and[/spoiler] commandered by [[Bright Noa]].

title: bright_noa
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]Bright Noa[/b] was first introduced in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (1979). He is a skilled [[Earth Federation]]/[[AEUG]]/[[earth_federation_space_forces|Londo Bell]] captain who commands many [[space]] battleships, notably the [[White Base]] and the [[Argama]]. A meme ([[Bright Slap]]) sprung up from the way he literally [[slapping|slaps]] some sense into his subordinates, notably [[Amuro Ray]].

Has appeared in many U.C. series and anime like [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985), [[Gundam ZZ]] (1986), [[Char's Counterattack]] (1988) and [[Gundam Unicorn]] (2010).

Father of [[Hathaway Noa]] and [[Cheimin Noa]]. [spoilers]Husband of [[Mirai Yashima]][/spoilers]

title: nasu_kinoko
body:
Nasu Kinoko (real name [b]Nasu Kunihiro[/b]) (born 28 November 1973) is a Japanese author, best known for writing the visual novels [[Tsukihime]] and [[Fate/stay night]]. Renowned for a unique style of storytelling and prose, Nasu is amongst the most prominent visual novelists in Japan.

For Danbooru purposes, this tag is referring to the [[Toad (mario)|]]-like [[artist self-insert]].

h4. See also

* Home page: http://www.remus.dti.ne.jp/~takeucto/

title: chibikemo
body:
A genre of popular [[furry]] character in Japan, literally being an abbreviation of [[chibi]] and [[furry|kemono]].

[b]Not all chibi furries are chibikemo[/b] - chibikemo characters are designed with very small proportions even by chibi standards, usually fitting into the archetype of "TDM" (a [[mascot]] character who is 2-3 heads tall).

Chibikemo characters often have big eyes, are primarily animal-shaped despite their bipedal stance and anthropomorphic behavior (often being [[digitigrade]]), and are frequently fantasy [[creature]]s.

[[Chibi]] itself might not always apply, depending on the proportions of the character.

h4. Examples

* !post #8281044
* !post #8246509

h4. See also

* [[deformed]]
* [[mini person]]

body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Tarou (series)|]]. His [spoiler]former[/spoiler] human host is [[Higashi Kotaro]].

He's also the son of both [[Mother of Ultra]] and [[Father of Ultra]], despite resembling his cousin, [[Ultraseven]].

He also has a powered up form known as [b]Super Ultraman Tarou[/b], which he achieves by merging with [[Ultraman]], [[Zoffy (ultra series)|]], Ultraseven, [[Ultraman Jack]], and [[Ultraman Ace]], the first instance of 'Ultra Overlapping' (fusion) in the series, turning him into a Super Ultra. He looks visually the same, with the exception of his body glowing with glitter at times.

body:

title: ultraman
body:
The titular hero of Tsuburaya Productions's [[Ultraman (1st series)|1966-1967 tokusatsu TV series]]. His human host is [[Hayata Shin]]. Due to Ultraman becoming a title for those of the Land of Light who have protected Earth, he is often referred to with additional names to distinguish him from his Ultra Brothers, such as [i]Shodai [Ultra-]Man[/i] ("The First [Ultra-]Man"), [i][Ultra-]Man-niisan[/i] ("Brother [Ultra-]Man"), or even just [i]Man[/i], with [i]Ultraman Hayata[/i], based on his host's name, becoming a popular choice for some younger Western fans.

In the original series, Ultraman went through three designs (referred to as Type A, Type B, and Type C), with Type C being the most common design used in appearances since, though with the first two being referenced from time to time. There was also a "Type D" design that existed briefly after the original series, used in stage shows, originating from converting [[Zoffy (Ultra Series)|]]'s suit back into an Ultraman suit, as his suit was originally the Type A suit (previously also used by [[Imit Ultraman]], and would go on to be used for [[Ultraman Jack]]). This would all establish a trend of slight redesigns for Ultras during and after their original series, especially those who look similar to one another.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3924093: Type C
* !post #421224: Type A

h4. See also

* [[Beta Capsule]]

title: rurima_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21073385
* !asset #21073383

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]]. Her extremely unique voice and realistic voice acting instantly made her one of Cookie's most popular characters and the breakout star of the entire Kuso series. Not of fan of the -aneki suffix to her name, so instead fans now call her Rurima-san. While initially accepting of the Cookie fame, she began to slowly get angrier with the fandom starting in 2017. Ended all of her accounts in 2021.

Identifiable by her [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], her [[pink apron]] with her [[character name|name]] [[clothes writing|on it]], and [[holding_grater|holding]] a [[hand grater]] used to make [[carrot shirishiri]]. Her voice acting in many doujin and adult works made her associated with dirty jokes and [[ANNYUI (cookie)|]], especially her line about omanko. Was a massive fan of the [[Touken Ranbu]] character [[Heshikiri Hasebe]] and is now drawn with a [[katana]], with some psychopathic edge.

title: satella_(rance)
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance Series]], introduced in [[Rance III]] as a major antagonist, before returning as an ally in later games.

A childhood friend of [[Hornet (Rance)|]] and a member of her faction, Satella is a cruel, but apathetic, Dark Lord who thinks lowly of humans, thinking of them like insects.

In Rance III and [[Rance 03|its remake]], she allies with [[Patton Misnarge]] of Helman, alongside her fellow Dark Lords [[Noce]] and [[Aizel]], to invade Leazas.

title: buran_(spacecraft)
body: The Soviet response to American space shuttles. A single working Buran spacecraft was built and flew one uncrewed mission back in 1988 before the project was canned due to the USSR collapse. The spacecraft itself was destroyed back in 2002 when the hangar it was housed in suffered a roof collapse.

title: melissa_kinrenka
body:
[b]Melissa Kinrenka[/b] is a former [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]]. 
Character designed anonymously. They graduated on 01 June 2022. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3770437.[/tn]

They have light [[green eyes]]. Their hair is [[very long hair|very long]] and colorful, consisting of [[white hair|white]], [[green hair|green]], [[blonde hair|yellow]], [[black hair|black]], and [[red hair|red]]. Although it's typically tied into [[twintails]], it isn't always.

h5. Default
While their shirt is [[white shirt|white]], it has what can only be described as a [[black dress]] covering parts of it. They have black [[short shorts]]. A [[black jacket]] hangs off of their arms and is rarely worn properly. Their shoes are black [[boots]].

A white [[single strap]] is slightly visible that is presumably attached to the shirt. From a glance, their shirt can easily be mistaken as being [[sleeveless]], a mistake many artist make.

h5. Alternate Outfits
When they reached 50,000 subscribers on YouTube, a new, much more simplistic outfit was featured. It's a [[grey hoodie]] with black [[striped sleeves|vertical stripes]] on their sleeves. A [[green trim]] is featured on the bottom of it and the inner-color is [[pink hoodie|pink]].

Their [[pants]] are somewhat [[baggy]]. Half of them are [[grey pants|grey]], while the other half is [[black pants|black]]. Orange and green [[strap]]s wrap around either leg asymmetrically. 

This outfit features a black [[choker]] and [[white footwear|white shoes]] with [[orange socks]].

They wear two hairstyles with this outfit: a [[short hair|short]] style and a much [[very long hair|longer]] style worn [[hair down|down]].

h4. Profile

title: godolphin_barb_(umamusume)
body:
In [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the Godolphin Barb refers both to one of the Three Goddesses of the [i]Umamusume[/i] universe as well as a training AI based on her, who is one of the hosts of the Grand Masters scenario. She represents "Love" and is represented by the color blue.

A [[horse girl]], she has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[blue_jacket|blue]] [[track jacket]] and [[black shorts]] as well as [[ear covers]]. She has an accessory on [b]her right ear[/b].

She is based on the Godolphin Barb (or Arabian), one of the foundation sires of the Thoroughbred breed of horses. His umamusume's blue theme is likely based on the Godolphin stable's royal blue racing silks. Through Matchem, he is the sire-line ancestor of about 1% of all Thoroughbreds. Even of all that, the overwhelming majority of living descendants are through Man O' War. In the context of [i]Umamusume[/i], he only has [[Calstone Light O (umamusume)|]] as a real-life descendant. Otherwise, [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]] would come the closest as the real horse's damsire (Silver Shark) is also of that sire-line.

h5. Associated characters
[[Darley Arabian (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
[[Byerley Turk (Umamusume)|]] - Fellow Goddess/Training AI
other_names: ゴドルフィンバルブ(ウマ娘)

title: onitsuka_tomari
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]. [[Onitsuka Natsumi]]'s younger sister. She is even more money-focused than her sister, thinking of things that don't make money as a waste of time.

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[aqua hair]] tied in [[twintails|twin]] [[twin braids|braids]], leaving [[sidelocks]] and two [[lone nape hair]]s.

Voiced by [[Sakakura Sakura]].

title: izayoi_sakuya
body:
The "Perfect and Elegant Maid". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later the third most recurring playable character (being playable in six official games) after protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]].

Head [[maid]] of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and personal attendant to its mistress [[Remilia Scarlet]] despite being the only human in the household. Sakuya possesses mastery of [[throwing knife|throwing knives]], as well as the ability to slow and stop time, making her somewhat a homage to [[Dio Brando]] of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. She is zealously loyal to Remilia, and is frequently depicted in doujin berating the gatekeeper, [[Hong Meiling]], though their relationship in canon is generally much friendlier. Due to her [[Immaterial and Missing Power]] portrait depicting her with considerably larger breasts than her usual portraits, jokes abound of her using [[breast padding]].

h4. Example

* !post #7492203: Usual Appearance
* !post #5610852: Full Body

h4. Related Pools

* Pool #5086:  Touhou - Sakuya's Pads
* Pool #21411:  Touhou - Sakuya's Elegant Knives

h4. See also

* [[breast padding]]
* [[knifed]]
* [[Tsurikichi Obasan]]
* [[Inu Sakuya (nejikirio)|]]: a dog-like caricature of Sakuya, from [[Nejikirio]]'s work.

title: koakuma
body:
A [[demon girl|female devil]]. Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] who lives in the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], often seen in the [[Voile]] [[Library]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[demon wings]] and [[bat wings|bat-like]] [[head wings]]. She has a [[demon tail]] and full [[demon wings]] on her back in some pictures.

It is generally assumed by the majority of fans that Koakuma is [[Patchouli Knowledge|Patchouli's]] summoned familiar and personal assistant, as she is rarely seen outside of the library unless accompanying the magician, and served as Patchouli's midboss in EoSD. She's also frequently depicted as a [[demon girl|succubus]] in fanworks, despite [[ZUN]] calling her more of an imp and her exact species being unknown.

Unused sprites in the EoSD game files include a possible "EX-Koakuma" with violet hair and a purple arcane aura, which might have been meant to appear alongside Patchouli during the Extra Stage midboss fight.

h4. Example

* !post #6561651: Usual Appearance

h4. See also

* [[Koa (phrase)]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Koakuma":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Koakuma]

title: hong_meiling
body:
Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], and later a recurring playable character.

A humanoid youkai (presumably resembling a Han Chinese). She works as the gatekeeper of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and specializes in Chinese martial arts. Unusually for a Touhou character, it is unclear what kind of youkai Meiling is, but many fans associate her with [[dragon]]s. This is in part due to the star on her [[beret]], which bears the Chinese character for "[[dragon]]" (龍, [i]Long[/i]). Hong is also the name of a specific dragon from Chinese mythology, implying Meiling has some relation (such as parent and child), or actually is Hong, leading to frequent depictions [[Hong Meiling (dragon)|as a dragon]]. There are also occasional images that depict her [[Hong Meiling (panda)|as a panda]].

Fandom also often depicts Meiling as being lazy and ineffective at her job, and often being berated and/or [[knifed|punished]] for this by [[Izayoi Sakuya]]. In canon, however, her relationship with Sakuya is actually something closer to amicable co-workers, if not outright friendship, and she is generally very good at her job of repelling intruders, with the notable exception of [[Kirisame Marisa]], who everyone else at the mansion admits is impossible to keep out when she wants access to [[Voile]].

Sometimes known by her nickname "China" (中国, [i]Chuugoku[/i]), which originated on [[2channel]] during a debate about the proper reading of her name's kanji (some believed it to be the Japanese reading "Kurenai Misuzu", and it wasn't until later that [[ZUN]] revealed that the Chinese reading "Hong Meiling" is correct). Fans came to an agreement that her defining characteristic is being Chinese, and thus called her "China".

h4. Example

* !post #4703408: Usual Appearance

h4. See also 

* [[Hong Meiling (dragon)]]
* [[Hong Meiling (panda)]]
* [[Hei Meiling]] 
* [[Lie Meiling]] 
* [[knifed]]

title: albion_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. The White Dragon of Welsh mythology. In the greater Fate universe, Albion is known for attempting to dig their way to the Reverse Side of the World, and perished doing so. The Mage's Association built the Clock Tower over Albion's remains.

[b]Huge spoilers below for Lostbelt no. 6: Fairy Realm of the Round Table, Avalon le Fay.[/b]
[spoiler]Albion is the true identity of [[melusine (fate)|Melusine (Fairy Knight Lancelot)]], who was created from the dying dragon's left hand. The party has to defeat Melusine after she transforms into a black version of Albion.[/spoiler]

title: avalon_le_fae_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 6: Fae Round Table Domain, Avalon le Fae[/b]
[quote]
The fierce battle in Olympus ended in Chaldea's victory over the Greek gods, as well as the confirmed simultaneous termination of the sixth Tree of Emptiness. Without the Tree of Emptiness, the sixth Lostbelt ceased to be a threat, leaving only the seventh Lostbelt to conquer.
...Or so it was believed.
But the Observation Lens Sheba projects a different future: the imminent collapse of the planet itself, triggered by the sixth Lostbelt.

There is hardly any time left until the planet's demise.
To prevent this untimely end, Chaldea sets foot in a mystical land inhabited by faeries—the British Lostbelt.
[/quote]
[expand=Part 2]
[quote]
"Chosen by the Staff of Selection, the savior, guarded by travelers from afar, shall reach the throne."

The key to the conquest of Britain is the defeat of Morgan, ruler of the Lostbelt.
The Song of Prophecy foretells her downfall once the Child of Prophecy journeys to ring the six Bells of Pilgrimage, protected by the six clans.
Also mentioned is a foreign mage—Chaldea's Master—who has been witnessed at the Child of Prophecy's side throughout Britain, giving credence to the divination.

Having earned an audience with the High Queen by warding off a Calamity, the party sets their sights on the fae capital—Camelot, the city of sin.
Prophecy and calamity, Faeries and humans.
What end awaits at the crossroads of fate once myriad expectations come into play?
[/quote]
[/expand]
The sixth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set on the isle of Great Britain and supervised by the Crypter [[Beryl Gut]]. It was released in three parts on the Japanese server on June 11, 2021, July 14, 2021, and August 4 2021, and on the NA server on June 6, 2023, June 20, 2023, and July 10, 2023.

title: patchouli_knowledge
body:
The "Unmoving Great Library". Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character in the first few fighting games.

She has [[very long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[purple eyes|matching eyes]], and [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[blue bow|blue]] and [[red bow|red]]/[[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair bows]]. She wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] or [[white headwear|white]] [[mob cap]] with a [[crescent hat ornament|crescent ornament]] on it, as well as a [[hat ribbon|ribbon]], and single or [[double bun]] [[bun cover|covers]]. She also wears a [[vertical-striped dress|vertically striped]], [[purple dress]] under a [[robe]] with [[long sleeves|long]], [[wide sleeves]], and has [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]] on them.

A magician youkai, resident librarian and instructor of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], and a close friend to [[Remilia Scarlet]]. She has mastery over the seven elements corresponding to Japanese weekday names - Sun, Moon, Fire, Metal, Wood, Water and Earth - earning her the nickname "One-Week Wizard", but her reclusive lifestyle (she's apparently not left her library in 100 years, which is interpreted in some doujins as signs of [[hikikomori]] behavior) has taken a toll on her health, limiting her powers by way of asthma and anemia. Due to her baggy clothing, her bust size and overall body shape are still open to debate.

On [[NicoNico]], she is linked to [[Gachimuchi]] thanks to "a certain misheard line":https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm2852390 uttered by [[Billy Herrington]]. Such images are tagged with: "Patchouli, Urgh!" in Pixiv.

h4. Example

* !post #8421082: Usual Appearance

h4. See also

* "[[Mukyuu]]", a nonsensical catchphrase attributed to her
* [[Voile]], the (unofficial) name generally used in reference to the mansion's library, which Patchouli tends
* [[Catchouli (hazuki ruu)|]], a disgustingly adorable [[chibi]] [[cat girl]] version created by [[Hazuki Ruu]]
* [[Patchoung (aoshima)|]], a version of her created by [[Aoshima]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Patchouli Knowledge":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Patchouli_Knowledge

title: judgement_armor
body:
Judgement Armor or Judgment Armos is the tier 2 paladin armor set of [i]World of Warcraft[/i].

"The Judgement concept is meant to be an Inquisitor-like outfit. The Silver Hand is an overall noble establishment, to be sure -- but there is a time when pleasantries must end and justice must be done. It is called the Judgement armor for a reason -- it is the Paladin's embodiment of delivering their sentence upon the enemy. This is not the defender aspect of the Paladin you're seeing; it is the commanding, faceless aspect of justice, of judgement. There is more to a Paladin than shining armor."

—Blizzard Community Manager Caydiem

title: fox_mccloud
body:
The protagonist of the [[Star Fox]] franchise, and the leader of the titular mercenary team.

The son of the late [[James McCloud]], he is a fearless hero and an excellent pilot, with few being on par with his skills, such as his fellow pilot [[Falco Lombardi]] and arch-nemesis [[Wolf O'Donnell]].

He is playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] franchise, and is available as a fighter in all five games. He is also infamous for being the best character in [i]Melee[/i], to the point where he became memetic among the Smash community.

title: sasha_(allenhara)
body:
Original character by [[Allenhara]]. A blonde, buxom transwoman.
As a child (pre-transition), had teased a long-haired androgynous boy named [[logan_(allenhara)|Logan]] for his looks. Was quite surprised when he grew into a tall muscular man, and subsequently became his lover.

title: logan_(allenhara)
body:
Original character by [[Allenhara]]. A small androgynous boy, teased for his long hair, who grew up into a tall burly man.
Became the lover of his former bully, who had grown up into a buxom transwoman named [[sasha_(allenhara)|Sasha]].

title: mallet_(instrument)
body:
A [percussion mallet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percussion_mallet#Mallets) used to play some percussion instruments, such as [[marimba]], [[xylophone]], and [[timpani]]. Made of a thin shaft (usually metal or wood) and a head of varying materials - most commonly metal, wood, rubber, plastics, or yarn - to produce a range of different sounds.

h4. See also

* [[drumsticks]]

title: pablo_picasso_(person)
body:
[b]Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso[/b] (1881-1973) was a [[spain|Spanish]] painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist and theatre designer who spent most of his adult life in France.

 One of the most influential artists of the 20th century, he is known for co-founding the Cubist movement, the invention of constructed sculpture, the co-invention of collage, and for the wide variety of styles that he helped develop and explore.

h4. See also
* [[Pablo Picasso (style)]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia article: "Pablo Picasso":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Picasso]

title: takizakura_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Takizakura Girls' Academy in [[Love Live! School Idol Musical]].

The main [[winter uniform]] consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[red jacket|red]] [[blazer]], a blue diagonal-striped [[necktie]] or [[bowtie]], and a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[skirt]]. Owing to the school's focus on modernity, the uniform's attributes can be freely swapped out or customized by students.

The [[summer uniform]] (shown in [[love live! school idol musical the drama|the drama adaptation]]) instead has a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] white shirt, no jacket, and a [[red skirt|red]] plaid skirt.

h4. See also
* [[Tsubakisakuhana school uniform]]

title: yozora_mel_(streetwear)
body:
The 7th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yozora Mel]].

It's a [[streetwear]]-themed costume consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] [[cat hat|cat ear-shaped]] [[baseball cap]] with "YZR" written on it, a [[black collar]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white tank top]] with a [[heart cutout|heart-shaped]] [[cleavage cutout]] and an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[orange skirt|orange]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[belt]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[black thighhighs]] with one regular thighhigh on one leg and a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] [[single fishnet legwear|on the other]], held with a [[single legwear garter|garter]] with  [[star o-ring|star]] [[o-ring]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high tops]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[wide ponytail]] with long [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]], decorated with multiple [[hairclip]]s on one side and either the [[bat hair ornament|bat-shaped]] or the [[star hair ornament|star-shaped]] hairclips from her previous costumes on the other. She also has [[extra ears|extra]] [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]]  with a [[tail ribbon]] and [[ear piercing]] on both her human and cat ears.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7129214: Profile
* !post #6280897: L2D

title: uruha_rushia_(school_uniform)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Uruha Rushia]], as seen in post #4915217 and post #4915223. 

It's a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[collared shirt]] or [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[blue bowtie|dark blue bowtie]], either a [[blue jacket|dark blue]] [[blazer]] a [[brown cardigan]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] or a [[white jacket]] with a [[bear hood]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[blue socks|dark blue socks]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[very long hair]] [[colored inner hair]] with a gradient from [[green hair|green]]/[[aqua hair|aqua]] to [[pink hair|pink]] with [[sidelocks]] and a [[french braid|french]] [[side braid]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], a large [[butterfly hair ornament]] and a smaller butterfly-shaped [[hairclip]] or [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]].

title: uruha_rushia_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Uruha Rushia]], as seen in  post #4323246 and post #4752880.

It's a [[gothic lolita]]-themed [[black dress|black]] [[off-shoulder dress]] with [[short sleeves]] with criss-cross [[frilled straps]] and [[see-through sleeves]], a [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker]], black [[wristband]]s and [[white thighhighs|white]] [[frilled thighhighs]] with [[white garter straps]].

She has a variation of this costume (post #4323254) with [[ear piercing|pierced]] [[cat ears]] with an [[ear ribbon]] and [[ghost earrings|ghost-shaped]] [[earrings]], also for her second anniversary  got another variation of this costume which changes her hairstyle and adds a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[mini crown]] and a [[black coat]] with a [[popped collar]], which she wears [[coat on shoulders|on her shoulders]].

She has several official hairstyles with this outfit:

* [[long hair|Long]] [[pink hair]] in a [[two side up]].
* [[short twintails|Short]] [[low twintails]] and an [[ahoge]] decorated with skull-shaped [[pom pom hair ornament]]s.
* [[long hair|Long]] [[asymmetrical hair]] with [[asymmetrical sidelocks]] and [[double bun]]'s with [[uneven twintails]].

title: uruha_rushia_(new_year)
body: The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Uruha Rushia]], as seen in post #3868978.

title: yozora_mel_(jirai_kei)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yozora Mel]].

Its a [[jirai kei]]-themed costume consisting of a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]] with a [[heart o-ring]], a [[frilled sweater|frilled]], a [[pink sweater|pink]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[aran sweater]], a [[shoulder cutout]] and [[frilled sweater|frills]] on the neckline and shoulders, a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]] held with a [[brooch]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] trim, an [[o-ring thigh strap]] also with a [[heart o-ring]], [[white socks|white]] [[bobby socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] shoes with [[platform heels]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and a [[gradient hair|gradient]] tied into [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[twintails]] with [[swept bangs]], an [[ahoge]] and [[sidelocks]] decorated with a [[hairclip]] with [[star hair ornament|stars]]. She also mas multiple [[ear piercing]], [[heart earrings]] and [[head wings]].

title: yozora_mel_(5th_costume)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yozora Mel]].

It's a [[gothic lolita]]-themed outfit consisting of a  [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar]] and [[center frills]] a bat-shaped [[brooch]], a black [[underbust]] [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laced]] [[bodice]], [[black sleeves|black]] [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[lowleg skirt|lowleg]] [[miniskirt]] (although it's almost [[microskirt]] in length) with a longer [[overskirt]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[frilled thighhighs]] with [[mismatched legwear|different patterns]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[strappy heels]] with a [[footwear bow|small bow on the top]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] held with a large [[heart hair ornament]] on one side and a regular [[hairclip]] on the other, she also has [[head wings]] and her hair has an orange-ish [[gradient hair|gradient]].

body:
The default 3D [[official alternate costume|costume]] and 2nd costume chronologically of [[hololive]]'s [[Yozora Mel]]. It's quite notable, because instead of getting a 3D version of her default outfit like the other hololive members, she got a major revision of her outfit for her 3D model.

It consists of a [[black bustier|black]] [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laced]] [[bustier]] with [[mini wings|miniature]] [[red wings|red]] [[bat wings]] on the back, [[short sleeves|short]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] with [[sleeve garter]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[overskirt]], [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]], a [[thigh strap]], [[uneven legwear]] (a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]] with a [[single garter strap|garter strap]] and a [[black socks|black]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]]) and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]] with [[winged footwear|wings]] on them.

title: world_baseball_classic
body:
The [b]World Baseball Classic[/b] is a worldwide [[baseball]] tournament held every four years in March that pits twenty teams from different countries against each other in both pool and tournament play to determine a world champion.

Japan has the most WBC titles with three (2006, [[2009 World Baseball Classic|2009]] and [[2023 World Baseball Classic|2023]]), while the Dominican Republic (2013) and the United States (2017) are tied with one apiece.

h4. External links

* "Main website":http://www.worldbaseballclassic.com/
* "Wikipedia: World Baseball Classic":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Baseball_Classic
other_names: ワールド・ベースボール・クラシック

title: baseball
body:
A bat-and-ball sport played between two teams of nine players. The aim is to score runs by hitting a thrown [[baseball (object)|ball]] with a [[baseball bat|bat]] and touching a series of four [[baseball base|bases]] arranged at the corners of a 90-foot diamond. 

Players on the batting team take turns hitting against the pitcher of the fielding team, which tries to stop them from scoring runs by getting hitters out in any of several ways. A player on the batting team can stop at any of the bases and later advance via a teammate's hit or other means. The teams switch between batting and fielding whenever the fielding team records three outs. One turn at bat for each team constitutes an inning and nine innings make up a professional game. The team with the most runs at the end of the game wins.

When referring to the ball and not the sport, use [[baseball (object)]].

h5. Related attire
* [[baseball mitt]]

title: master_crown
body:
An ancient artifact in the [i][[Kirby (series)|]][/i] games, introduced in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i]. It is said to give its wearer unlimited power.

[spoiler]The main story of [i]Kirby's Return to Dream Land[/i] is driven by [[Magolor]]'s efforts to steal the Crown from its current guardian, [[Landia]]. After enlisting the help of [[Kirby]] [[king_dedede|and]] [[meta_knight|his]] [[bandana_waddle_dee|friends]], he succeeds in doing so and attempts to conquer the universe, starting with [[Pop Star]]. The Crown's influence and evil sentience get the better of him and he transforms into a [[magolor_soul|monster]] that is swiftly defeated by Kirby and company.[/spoiler]

[spoiler][[Void Termina]] is able to summon the Crown (or at least a replica of it) during his boss battle in [i][[Kirby: Star Allies]][/i]. This along with the Jambastion sigil closely resembling the Crown suggests a strong connection with him, [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]], and the twisted treasure.[/spoiler]

[spoiler][i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]][/i] confirms that the Master Crown is in fact, sentient, having brought the downfall of multiple civilizations in the past. In the [i][[Magolor Epilogue]][/i], it first enhances the [[Grand Doomer]] into the Crowned Doomer, then assimilates the [[Gem Apple]] to turn into [[master crown (tree)|a tree monster]] before being poetically struck down by Magolor’s [[Ultra Sword]].[/spoiler]

title: alice_margatroid
body:
The "Seven-Colored Puppeteer".

[[Touhou]] character. Stage 3 and Extra Stage boss of [[Mystic Square]] and later a recurring playable character. One of the few [[touhou (pc-98)|PC-98 era]] characters (along with [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]) to reappear in the Windows-era games. She first appeared in her current design as the Stage 3 boss of [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]. She is often accompanied by her dolls, [[Shanghai Doll]], [[Hourai Doll]], or [[Goliath Doll]].

A human-turned-youkai [[witch]] who specializes in manipulating [[doll]]s and using them to attack her enemies. Unlike [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]], her neighbor in the [[Forest of Magic]], Alice is not only rather aloof, but also somewhat cowardly at heart, refusing to use her full power for any reason because she would not know how to deal with losing. This nature leads to [[doujinshi]] portraying her as having some tendencies of being [[tsundere]] towards her [[human village (touhou)|human neighbor]]. Speculated to be the daughter of [[Shinki (touhou)|]]. Bearer of the [[Grimoire of Alice]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7010229: Usual Appearance
* !post #2191177: [[Alice Margatroid (pc-98)|PC-98]][br]([[Mystic Square]])

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[frilled hairband|frilled]] [[red hairband]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[pink neckerchief|pink]] or [[red neckerchief]], a [[white capelet]] over a (possibly) [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[pink sash|pink]] or [[red sash]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

h4. See also

* [[Alice-type underwear]]
* [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)]]
* [[Shanghai Doll]]
* [[Hourai Doll]]
* [[Goliath Doll]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Alice Margatroid":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Alice_Margatroid

title: swiss_guard
body:
The [b]Papal Swiss Guard[/b](also known as the Papal Guards) is an elite military unit from [[Switzerland]] that have protected the [[Pope]] since 1506. 

While the name "Swiss Guard" originally meant an elite bodyguard unit of Swiss soldiers that protected some European Monarchs in the past, today, the name now refers to the Papal Swiss Guard in Vatican City ever since Switzerland banned the practice of their citizens working in foreign armies since 1848 with the Vatican being an exception.

The Papal Swiss Guard are famous for their renaissance era uniforms and wielding halberds while on duty.  As their name reveals, only Swiss, Catholic males who are single, around the ages 19 to 30 and served in the Swiss Armed Forces may join the Papal Swiss Guard.

title: banzai_bill
body:
A larger version of a [[Bullet Bill]], known in Japanese as [i]Magnum Killer[/i]. Aside from the size, the common main differences is that the Banzai Bill has a visible mouth with [[sharp teeth]] and lacks arms.

Renamed in English as [b]Boomer Bill[/b] for the [[LEGO Super Mario]] [i]Boomer Bill Barrage Expansion Set[/i] in 2020, and renamed again as [b]Bomber Bill[/b] on the official [[Super Mario World]] website on the Mario Portal in 2022. The Bomber Bill rename is seemingly being kept for the foreseeable future, with its usage in the [[The Super Mario Bros. Movie]] in 2023 and [[Super Mario Party Jamboree]] in 2024.

title: forced_partners
body:
When two or more unwilling individuals are forced to participate in sexual acts with each other. 
This might be because of being [[bound together]] by restraints, being coerced, or because of being under (apparent) duress, such as being held [[at gunpoint]] or other [[threat]]s.

If any (but not all) of the participants [i]are[/i] willing, you should probably use the [[rape]] tag instead.
Avoid using this tag when the participants are merely under [[hypnosis]] or [[mind control]], unless their powerless "inner selves" are also portrayed witnessing the scene. 

h4. See also

* [[forced]]
* [[rape]]
* [[bisexual female]]

title: gyaru_v
body:
An upside-down [[V]] gesture.

The original term is called "Gyaru-peace", which is a combination of the Japanese pronunciation of "Gal," an English slang for women and girls, and the English word "Peace," which means finger gesture [[V]].

Originating from Japan's [[Gyaru]] culture, it is a hand gesture that first extends the arm forward and turns the palm up and down after making a V-shape by hand.

title: super_princess_peach
body:
A [[Princess Peach]]-themed spin-off to the [[Mario (Series)|Super Mario]] franchise, released on the [[Nintendo DS]] in 2005.

In a role reversal [[Mario]] is the one kidnapped by [[Bowser]], along with [[Luigi]] and multiple [[Toad_(mario)|]]s. With the help of [[Perry_(mario)|Perry]], a living umbrella with amnesia, she sets off to rescue them and confront Bowser who wields the [[Vibe Scepter]].

title: alicia_cotton
body:
A Vietnamese/English [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]]. A [[pink hair]] [[cat girl]] with [[blue eyes]]. Her illustrator is [[rionkun81]].

She is a cat from Candy Land that loves sweet things and draws! The reason why she is on Earth is that she decided to make many new friends.

title: yoshi's_island_ds
body:
Sequel to [i][[Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island]][/i], released in 2006 on the [[Nintendo DS]].

[[Yoshi]] and [[Baby Mario]] go to save all the babies who were kidnapped by [[Kamek]] and his [[Toady|Toadies]]. 

Aside from Baby Mario other babies are featured. These are [[Baby Peach]], [[Baby Donkey Kong]] and [[Baby Wario]].

title: wind_hawk_(ragnarok_online)
body:
4th job of the Hunter class tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually are equipped with [[holding bow (weapon)|bow]]s and [[holding arrow|arrow]]s and accompanied by a [[hawk]] or [[wolf]].

Males wear a [[brown jacket|brown]] [[shrug (clothing)|]] with [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], a [[fur collar]], a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[crop top]] showing [[midriff]] and [[navel]], a [[chest harness]], [[brown gloves]], [[multicolored pants]] of [[brown pants|brown]], [[blue pants|blue]], and [[purple pants|purple]], [[pants tucked in|tucked into]] [[fur-trimmed boots|fur-trimmed]] [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. 

Females wear a similar costume but with [[fur-trimmed shorts|fur-trimmed]] [[brown shorts]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]] instead.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7312474
* !post #7312483

title: miyamoto_musashi_(fate)
body:
Saber-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She's a genderswap of the famous samurai of the [[Miyamoto Musashi|same name]] who killed his first man in a duel at age 13,  founded the Niten Ichi-ryū (二天一流) style of swordsmanship and wrote The Book of Five Rings (五輪の書).

She has [[pink hair]] in a [[ponytail]] held by a fan-like [[hair ornament]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Initially wears a [[blue kimono|blue]] [[sleeveless kimono]] with an [[obi]], black [[detached sleeves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[sandals]]. Later her kimono becomes more elaborate, gaining a [[navel cutout]], a red cloth with a [[maple leaf print]], and more red details. The chest area is also revealed. Sometimes her sleeves are also [[wide sleeves|widened]]. She has maple [[earrings]] and [[dual wielding|wields two]] [[katana|katanas]] while keeping two more [[sheathed]] at her waist.

She has a [[miyamoto musashi (swimsuit berserker) (fate)|swimsuit version]] for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Illustrator[/b]: [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice actress[/b]: [[Sakura Ayane]]

* [[miyamoto musashi (bunny) (fate)|Bunny]]

title: caenis_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the Lostbelt arc. Caenis is a woman who was raped by Poseidon. Afterwards, Poseidon granted her a wish; Caenis wished to become an invulnerable warrior. Poseidon granted her wish, turning Caenis into Caeneus. Along with her physical body, her name changed into [b]Caeneus[/b] to differentiate between the two.

h4.Variants
